author: {'steamid': '76561197971641204', 'num_games_owned': 1928, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1459042063}
review:
Nice indie game:

+ Beautiful art (the ratcoon is so cute! :D)
+ Good soundtrack
+ Easy to pick up and play

- Only 1 map for the campaign (not even a map, it's just a background)
- The grind for gold to get the upgrades you need to beat the final stage (last 5 waves) is INSANE (replaying the same waves over and over to farm gold -> not fun)

It took me 4 hours to beat (of course I used a "helper program" to avoid hours of mind numbing gold farming). If you enjoy farming waves it should last you WAY longer than that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113018027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1437470817}
review:
For me it was really a very boring game, but if you like tower defence like games, then you might like it.

I bought it and I thought it was a great game from the images. I tried to like it, but from the very first minutes with the intro, I felt it a 'silly' game. Anyway, I tried to like it, but I couldn't. It seems to have many various things and interesting gameplay, but it is very repetitive at its core.

It ended in my "Abandoned" games category.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972761503', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1456535579}
review:
Plutôt bien.

Bardbarian fait partie de ces petits jeux sympathiques qui vous feront passer quelques heures à débloquer tous les personnages, découvrir tous les monstres et vaincre le boss final. Les graphismes sont colorés, le jeu est nerveux, la musique est rythmée ; bref le jeu fait passer un bon moment autour d'une idée amusante. Certains reviendront y faire une partie de temps en temps, d'autres plus acharnés iront jusqu'à tout débloquer (ce qui demande du temps plutôt que du talent).

Ce n'est pas le jeu de l'année, mais vous avez peu de risque de ne pas l'apprécier. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198277011659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1457465237}
review: This game was a positive surprise for me. The game is about a former barbarian who was sick of fighting with weapons and decided to turn his axe into a lute. With his lute he summons different warriors by his side to attacktheir enemies. The game is a basically a tower defense game but you can only place towers next to your character, and then you run around the field protecting the village crystal. It's a common concept with it's on twist, and the music is really good. Charming graphics and nice controls makes this a fine game. You also have 2 other game modes except the story. Survival which is one big screen, lots of enemies, and you running in circles to survive. Then we have Escape mode, which is screen scrolling mode, where you simply try to escape the darkness coming in from the left. In total the game has many hours of gameplay, and lots to give. 7.6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197975373553', 'num_games_owned': 1873, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 1084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1084, 'last_played': 1457452079}
review: I found this game to be polished and nice looking, but the gameplay is lackluster and mind-numbingly repetetive. The same bullet dodging goes on for 8+ hours and upgrades and units make very little difference, Maybe it would play better on a tablet? As a pc-gamer I expect more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022266051', 'num_games_owned': 3249, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1457199537}
review:
[h1]A decent "tower defense" game where you play, get gold, die, buy upgrades, and repeat until you're finally able to fend off all the advancing hordes.[/h1]

So in that sense...it's pretty repetitive, especially the beginning levels since you have to play them so much to level up your favorite companions to then make it further in the game.  Your companions are the only way to attack enemies for you are the bard player, their leader, and they trail behind you or just in front of you whever you go.  For companions, you do get a wide variety that unlock as you progress in the game, from short range heavy damage, to long range low damage, healers, and other abilities, etc.  I found if I just picked a couple to focus on and upgrade those, I found I could go farther.

For what it is, the game is pretty well done and I had a pretty good time, but the game could definitely use more music -- that just added to the repetitive feeling of the game.

[h1]The Good:[/h1]
[b]+ Nice graphics.[/b]  I like the style and the theme of the game.
[b]+ Nice style of gameplay.[/b]  Leading the companions to do the attacking for you.
[b]+ Entertaining.[/b]  I not only finished the campaign but continued on to complete some additional Steam Achievements.
[b]+ Nice upgrade options.[/b]  You can upgrade yourself (health, speed, number of followers, etc), your companions (health, damage), and your town (pet, health/gold bonuses while playing, strength, defenses).
[b]+ Couple other game modes.[/b]  [u]Survival Mode[/u] where you just run around (not in town) and see how long you can survive where you are given a few periodic random drops like bacon (for health) and followers.  And [u]Distance[/u], where without any followers you see how far you can run without taking a single hit.  They're both fun for a few attempts, but I like that they were included.

[h1]The OK:[/h1]
[b]~ Every level the same.[/b]  It's always your town.  The monsters change.  Nothing else.  Not even the lighting despite the levels being grouped into different times of the day.  (Morning, Noon, Evening, Night).

[h1]The Bad:[/h1]
[b]~ Too repetitive.[/b]  Felt too much like grinding the same levels over and over to get gold to level up your guys to survive longer.

[h1]Overall:  This is a fun Tower Defense game with a 5.7hr campaign (for me), suffering only from being too repetitive early on.  7.5 out of 10.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994240027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1453708257}
review:
Suffers from the same problem as all tower defense games, but even worse.

The game is clever enough but destroys itself with constant, required grinding. The gameplay is unique overall, but you plain cannot fight through a level without passing a stat check you will not reach through normal play. Your damage will simply be too low to kill the hordes fast enough.

What seemed like a fun game has turned to trash because a terrible upgrade/exp system built only to waste your time rather than to give choice and meaningful growth.

review: Grindy and not terribly engaging. It looks and feels like something you'd play briefly on Kongregate or Newgrounds. Plays a bit like Snake crossed with a bullet hell shooter, only your satellites have HP and do the brunt of the damage, and you're constantly grinding gold for ~upgrades~.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010739000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1583007675}
review:
I didn't really know what to expect out of this game. Thankfully, it's not so hard to pick up. It throws you right into the game without any notable intro/knowledge but don't worry, figuring everything out is a matter of few minutes. It doesn't take long and you will be addicted to [i]Bardbarian[/i].

[b][h1]======OVERVIEW======[/h1][/b]

[i]Bardbarian[/i] takes the Tower Defense genre to a whole new level, where you can actually influence the outcome of a battle, whether you just move differently or have other units spawned. Every level usually somehow differs each time you play it. However, if you play a certain level few times, you can actually remember when and where a specific enemy spawns. That being said, it is not a big deal since you'd have to spend too many hours in this game to actually remember the pattern of spawning. Besides the regular adventure/story mode, there are two more game modes: survival and escape. Both of them bring a fresh air if you're just burnt out of the main mode and I must say that surprisingly enough, I've enjoyed these. Plus you can unlock some of otherwise not approachable units and you can come up with some other interesting strategies. So far I'm using ordinary units more but might give those specials try if I ever struggle with some specific level. And yeah, you'll find yourself struggling with a level more often than you're willing to admit but don't worry, it gets better with almost every upgrade. Far better when you find yourself some comfortable unit combinations. One more noticable thing: sound. The way this game works with soundtrack and sound effects is just beautiful.

[b][h1]PROS[/h1]
- visual side
- controls/gameplay
- trading cards
- sound effects and soundtrack
- grinding
- replay value
- achievements + trading cards
- crossover features with other indie games

[h1]CONS[/h1]
- lacks events/seasons updates [i](last update was on Halloween, still in the game to this game which kinda doesn't make sense)[/i][/b]

[b][h1]======RATING======[/h1][/b]
I love this game. It sets the standard for Tower Defense games too high and it'll honestly be a hard quest for other games to overcome the great experience I've had playing Bardbarian. I'd highly recommend it to every casual gamer out there, heck, even to those hardcore gamers, you can spend some quality time playing this game as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055232329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1455519314}
review:
Bardbarian is called a tower defense, but it plays like a shoot em up. You control a bard who doesn't attack, but leads around some helper minions who automatically shoot at any enemies they see. After every death you can upgrade your hero, helper units, or town bonuses.

The game is not very long, but there is enough content, and the music is great. Dying isn't so bad because you can just upgrade something and return more powerful next time to progress further.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963485875', 'num_games_owned': 1683, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1705703594}
review:
Bardbarian is a nice tower style RPG action defense type of game (if that is even a thing?!)

[b]Gameplay[/b]

In Bardbarian you play as Brad who set's out to defend the precious towns Crystal (and protecting all the residents of the town) calling upon the help of various useful warriors, ninja's, medics etc that are all available for you to choose your own army.
The core mechanic of the game is basically a scrolling from left to right action fest where anything that moves or comes your way from the right you must use your own chosen small army to ensure they are taken out before they come anywhere near the town's crystal and inflict damage.
Bardbarian is a large game that has tonnes of replayability and XP grinding (that doesn't seem much of chore). It has a nice mechanic that keeps the game flowing along nicely allowing you to upgrade your arsenal of chosen Warriors after each fight is over!

[b]Graphics/Music[/b]

Being an Indie game it is sometimes hit and miss with what graphics can be on offer but I personally found the overall 'sheen' and 'quality' to be of a very high standard. 
The music seems to suit the game well, I liked the touch of the little guitar 'licks' each time you engaged Brad to summon a warrior or power. I accidently left the title screen music playing for about 30 mins on once occasion and it didn't grate on me either which is definitely not a bad thing.

[b]Pros/Cons[/b]

Pros 
+ Pleasing high-quality graphics and production.
+ A Casual game but still has that 'one more game before I turn it off.. appeal!'.
+ Wide arrays of characters for your arsenal of good guys.
+ Extra game modes to play alongside the main campaign.

Cons 
- Took a long time to figure out the correct (and best) upgrade paths for your team.
- Can have a frustrating one hit death to your main character Brad at the most inconvenient times.

[b]Final/Personal Thoughts[/b]

Bardbarian is a high-quality Indie title that I personally enjoyed playing through, yes it can be frustrating at times but as soon as you have put some time and effort into the game it will reward you with revisiting the same levels but the game being a lot easier to conquer (having a team with fully upgraded warriors!).
Recommended purchase if on sale or part of a bundle!

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
https://twitter.com/osgamegeek - Check out my Twitter Feed

author: {'steamid': '76561198014020460', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1155, 'last_played': 1454249273}
review:
敵からクリスタルを守れ！っていうアクション型タワーディフェンス。
主人公は何をしてるかというと何もしない。
そのかわりに雇った奴らがやっつけてくれる。
雇った奴らは個性があり、また強化することでクリアを容易にしてくれる。

ゲームとしては10時間あればクリアまで可能。

で、他ゲーからやってきたキャラクターが使えないのなんの。
結局「自分が考えた最強の構成」さえ見つかれば用無し。
クリスタルなんて守る価値無し。だいたいやられるのはプレイヤー。

安かったら遊んでやってもいいんだよ。みたいな感じで。
個人的には遊べた。iPhoneアプリでもあるかもしれないけど、コントローラで遊んだ方が楽だよ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198043898178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1422747893}
review: Finished the campaign and tried the side games. Worst game I've played this year so far, I'm mostly baffled by how they completely missed the point of a tower defense game: it's the first game I can remember where you're supposed to lose countless times before winning, you literally can't win the game on your first try. That's a pretty big design fail in my opinion: one of the most important mechanics in a tower defense is being able to buy and upgrade units on the go, in order to adjust to what the waves of enemies contain; here you can't, you just choose three type of units at the beginning and that's it, you can't even upgrade on the field, you have to lose to do it (but you have to grind the money playing and dying soo thereafter), of course the units are severely underpowered at first so the whole system falls on itself and crumbles. Disappointing in almost every way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048998514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1453916793}
review:
バーバリアンなのにリュートを演奏してやって来た戦士たちに戦ってもらうゲーム
プレイ前はRPGかストラテジーの類だろうと思っていたが実際の印象はタワーディフェンスだと感じた

プレイヤーであるバーバリアンは一切攻撃を行えない
代わりに時間経過で増えていく音楽ポイントを消費して、リュートをかき鳴らして別の戦士や魔法使いなどを呼んだり彼らを一時的に音楽の力で強化したりする
要は召喚とバフだけある
それ以外は基本的な移動と殺戮ゲージを消費して周囲の敵を一時的にスタンさせるぐらいしか出来ない

召喚出来るユニットは十数種類いるが戦闘に連れていけるのは３種類まで
プレイヤーの前に立って攻撃をする近接キャラから後方から遠距離攻撃をする魔法使いなど結構色々いる

このゲームの目的はマップ左側にある神聖な噴水を最後まで守りぬくこと
敵はマップの右から現れて、近くにプレイヤーがいない限り噴水へ向かって破壊しようとする
プレイヤーが近くにいると目標をプレイヤーに変更するので時間稼ぎが出来る
プレイヤーはマップ左の噴水とマップ右のモンスター出現地点との間を駆けまわって呼び出したユニットに戦ってもらうことになる
このあたりがタワーディフェンスによく似ていると思った

シューティングアクションの要素もあって、プレイヤーは結構弱くて少しの攻撃で死んでしまのでモンスターの攻撃を避ける必要もある

クリアまでのプレイ時間は結構短い
死ぬたびにアップグレードショップに寄れるので下手くそでもお金を稼げば必ずクリアできる

author: {'steamid': '76561198168355743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1453857868}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063990605', 'num_games_owned': 3313, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1413852645}
review:
Bardbarian é um jogo sandbox em que você assume o papel de um bárbaro somado com um bardo "BardBarian" (para quem não sabe um bardo é aqueles músicos das idades antigas)

Seu objetivo é proteger um pequeno reino que esta sobre constante ataque de vááárias e vááárias ondas de inimigos, a cada onda vai ficando mais complicado e vai aparecendo inimigos com diferentes habilidades.
Para proteger este reino, você usa sua guitarra para tocar diferentes sons, com essas musicas que você toca, você invoca/chama novos reforços e pode ativar buffs e melhorias para você, suas unidades e o Reino.

Já ouvi pessoas comparando este jogo com um tower defence... mas sei lá... não vejo muito TD nesse jogo.
Você na verdade apenas contrata tropas que ficam seguindo seu personagem, essas tropas atacam as unidades inimigas próximas, seu bardbarian ganha XP conforme avança nas ondas e mata inimigos, e com esse XP upa suas tropas e compra novas habilidades e melhorias...
Então basicamente seu único objetivo é andar pelo mapa tentando desviar dos ataques inimigos e fazendo suas tropas atacarem automaticamente as unidades próximas...
Ao meu falar o jogo pode parecer monótono não é? Mas é ai que você se engana...
Ele é muito divertido e viciante, você sempre tem vontade de passar mais uma onda e conseguir mais dinheiro e XP.
Recomendo-o com toda certeza :D

O jogo conta com uns outros modos de jogo, como sobrevivência e uma espécie de corrida em que seu personagem segue uma linha reta com vários obstáculos...
Alem do modo Hardcore que é 10x mais difícil que o modo normal de jogo.

O jogo conta com algumas referencias a outras jogos indies que achei interessantes :P

As gráficas do jogo são 2D cartunizados, é um estilo que achei muito simpático.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049171948', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1561700548}
review:
即時塔防加上用音樂招喚幫手拖著打怪，遊戲設計得太死，強迫走同樣關卡【賺錢>死亡>升級>賺錢>死亡>升級>循環...】，雖然可用角色越來越多，但是每次的遊玩時間太長，前面太簡單，後期又太難，缺乏動力去測試與搭配各種角色來應戰，讓人越玩越無趣。

優點：
+討喜的人物圖像設計
+多樣化的隊伍組合，即時塔防與技能搭配使用增加了變化性
+還不錯的音樂搭配

缺點：
-走著重複的關卡賺錢升級很膩，過程又不算有趣
-可使用角色太多，讓人懶的一一去測試性能
-有時這輪花了很多時間玩，但一失足成千古恨，不容易翻身

author: {'steamid': '76561198127254171', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1418315784}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003494900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1366, 'last_played': 1541845463}
review:
自分は攻撃できず味方のみで戦うタワーディフェンス風味のアクションゲームです
自分は見方を呼んで、ひたすら弾除けに集中します
タワーディフェンスは嫌いなジャンルなのですが
このゲームはとても楽しめました

このゲームはタワーディフェンスというよりほぼアクションゲームです
シビアな操作と、パーティー編成を吟味する必要があり
見た目はしょぼいのですが、かなり熱いアクションゲームになっています

批判はキャラデザがダサいのとBGMがうるさいうえに、時間が止まるところです
途中でオプションでBGMをミュートにしてしまいました
最初絶対このガチムチの主人公は戦うと思い
攻撃ボタンを探したのですが、しばらくたってから戦わないゲームだと
ようやく気付きました。もっとスリムな主人公にしてくれよ

ゲームバランスはコラボキャラのタコ、カメ、肉の三体が酷い性能で
地雷キャラになっています。これは酷いと思いました
それからキャラの説明に前衛と後衛とコストが表記されていません
演奏は三種類とっさに使い分けるのは難しすぎで、ほぼ攻撃しか使いませんでした

最後にユニットにはコストが設定されているのですが、
ゲーム後半はアップグレードによって演奏ポイントがたくさんたまるようになるので
ユニットの選択は高コスト一択になります
それで低コストは入れる必要がなくなるのが、残念だなと思いました

author: {'steamid': '76561198093179039', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1437010798}
review:
[b]Sehr nettes Spiel :D[/b]
Habe es zwar hauptsächlich auf meinem Handy gespielt (und das muss was heißen, ich habe auf meinem Handy nur zwei Spiele "Kingdom Rush" und eben "Bardbarian").
Es ist ein toller Zeitvertreib und immer gut für zwischendurch, wenn man mal auf den Bus oder Zug wartet.

Das Spieldesign habe ich so auch noch nicht gesehen hat etwas von einem RPG und auch ein paar MOBA Elemente.

Fazit: wem gerade langweilig ist und wer nichts zu tun hat holt sich einfach Bardbarian (aber für das Handy, macht meiner Meinung nach viel mehr Sinn als für PC) und spielt ein paar Runden :D
Echt nur zu empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994554989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1452920518}
review:
Забавная игруля. Почему-то сразу вспоминаю Brutal Legend. Видимо это из-за топора-гитары и бородатого рокера.
Эта игра отлично подойдёт для отдыха. Особой сложности нет, если уровень не прошёл с первого раза, то пройдёшь со следующего, ну или с пятого, но точно пройдёшь ибо ты зарабатываешь золото, а золото можно тратить на улучшения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198227756860', 'num_games_owned': 682, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1452902388}
review:
QUE VIVA EL ROCK ESA ES LA SENSACION DE JUGAR ESTE JUEGO, ERES UN GUITARISTA QUE ATRES A TUS COMPAÑEROS PARA QUE TE DEFIENDA DE LOS MALOS QUE QUIEREN ACABAR CON TIGO.

10/10

review:
I found this an interesting twist on Tower Defense games. Instead of having the enemies on a set path, they just all come in where ever, and you have to drag the 'towers' behind you. Also, there's a bit of a bonus for fans of a few other games in there, in the form of special heroes/towers you can unlock in the various modes.

Music's a bit repetitive, though.

review:
Un'ottima variante dei tower defence, con un buon stile ed una buona idea di base: Tramite la sua chitarra il barbaro può richiamare e potenziare varie unità che combatteranno per lui.
Si sente un pò troppo la deriva "gioco per tablet" ed alla lunga può risultare ripetitivo. Giocatelo a piccole dosì e vi divertirà per una buona decina di ore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044395534', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1450538913}
review:
Cosa fa un Barbaro quando è stanco di grindare mostri per drop e XP? Smette di combattere e diventa un Bardbaro! 

Devo ammettere che ero scettico rispetto a questo gioco. Il trailer è semplice ma invitante, e sebbene ami questo tipo di gioco demenziale (e il metal) pensavo mi avrebbe deluso. E invece no. È semplice, è divertente, e a un certo punto diventa molto difficile e costringe a pensare a strategie particolari per superare i livelli.

Fondamentalmente, questo gioco è una parodia del classico D&D: il Bardo, incapace di fare null'altro, suona e buffa gli alleati. In questo caso, la musica serve sia a buffare il party che a costruirlo, evocando delle unità da scegliere da un pool di una ventina di personaggi (inizialmente, sono solo due o tre, poi si sbloccano tutti). I buff e le invocazioni vengono da assoli che Brad (il protagonista) fa con la sua arma/chitarra. 

Devo ammettere che mi ha sorpreso, e divertito per il suo costo (pagato 99 centesimi durante i saldi). Se siete interessati, provate la versione mobile che è gratuita!

ROCK ON!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043051654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1449583579}
review:
very fun! 

you are Brad, a barbarian in charge of defending the town, who got bored of midless brawling and decided to become a bard. so you into this arena and have to defend the town against waves of monsters. the goal is prevent them to destroy a big diamond (kinda like the emperium in WoE, if you've played ragnarok online). to do that, you summon some fighters by playing solos with your axe-like-guitar. you can also play solos to buff yourparty, one for attack, one for defence and one for speed. there is also a stun solo, which you can use after playing a few songs (5 in a row if i'm not mistaken); this stun solo does literally what it says, leaves all foes inside a certain radius paralyzed. to perform your songs you spend musical notes, which generate with time (faster when you stand still) or when it drops. monsters also drop gold, which you can use to buy upgrades (buffing summons, buffing songs, increasing your life and many others). 

there are also two other game modes: survival and i forgot the name of the other one. but i haven't played them yet.

 in my oponion, only two problems: 

1) every 30 minutes there is a bug that doesn't allow me to play the solos anymore. i have to restart the game so it starts working again. the first two times, you think that's ok, but it gets very annoying when it keeps happening.

2) the soundtrack is cool, but mind-numbing repetitive. even the solos and the summoning songs are cool at first, but get boring once you've heard them for the 100th time.

other than these two issues (which are frustrating) i think this is a very cool game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000113517', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1449378610}
review:
I'm personally a big fan of tower defense style games, my absolute favorite beig Orcs Must Die! 2. Bardbarian, however, is a very close second.

With Bardbarian, you don't actually do any attack yourself, or set up towers that attack lanes of enemies. Instead, you move freely about the battlefield, commanding your troops who you bring in with "Sick Lute Licks," which in turn attack the enemies who come in from the right side of the screen. With a variety of attackers (Some long range, some short), a variety of enemy types, and a slew of upgrades to make your life easier, it's a fun game to play...if only for a few hours.

The main issue I personally have with the game is that there is litle longevity to it. Once you learn the enemy types and ugrade everythin to max, you could probably beat the game within 6-8 hours, even less if your quick about upgrading your stuff. Even the addition of an insane mde, which barely amps up the difficulty itself, isn't enough to satisfy me for very long. The game does however, have three main games modes.

The campaign is split up in to four sections with five levels each. At the end of each level is a boss. Beat the waves, beat the boss, move on. Simple enough. The other two modes aren't so standard. Survival has you in an enclosed area with enemies coming from all angles. Instead of summoning your troops like you do in hte campaign, you find them on the field. This is nice because the notes you generate to normally summon units can be diverted solely on powerups for them. It stinks because they don't spawn into the gamtoo quickly, and you are often times left defenseless, seeing as you are unable to attack on your own. The final mode is Escape, and its basically a run right as long as you can while a wall of death follows you. You collect gold along the way and avoid enemies, making it a good mode to make some quick gold if you need to.

All in all, the first few hours of the game were just plain fun for me. Unlocking new allies was always nice, and upgrading them, the town and myself added that extra touch. The other games modes were a lot of fun too. But as I stated befor,e once you get into the 6 hour mark, and have upgraded almost everything...it get sold fast. If the game has any future updates, I'm unaware, so as of right now, it's a good experience, but for a limited time.

If you want a game to kill a few hours with, I highly recommend it. If you want something that will keep you entertained for a long time...this will help ease the pain of waiting for Fallout 4 to download...

If you thought this review was helpful, let me know! I like doing these, and plan on doing more for the other 190 games I own, so please let me know if this helped! Also, check out some of the other reviews I've done, and have fun playing!

review:
Вроде тауэр-дефенсные побегушки на одной (!) карте под одну (!) мелодию. Башен никаких не строим, сами не стреляем, а только нанимаем юниты да выполняем соло на гитаре для спец-приемов. Игру спасает трехчасовая продолжительность, приличная система прокачки, а также режим выживания (на другой карте, ехха!), мини-раннер (на третьей карте!) и возможность сдерживать новые волны врагов после окончания основной кампании.  

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198011275042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1447104099}
review:
A game with a lot of unexplored potential. Feels like a flash game you could be playing for free on kongregate. The units are pretty creative and varied, but the rest of the game is the same old thing time and again. No matter how many stages you beat you'll never leave the same area and for a game about a 'bard' it sure has a POOR variety in music...

You can do almost nothing besides summoning units and roaming around with them dodging projectiles while they do all of the job, leaving you to activate powers every now and then and that's about it. This game grows boring early. I bought it dirty cheap during a sale so no regrets here but I don't think I'd ever reccomend this to anyone.

I find it funny that the character in the main screen follows your mouse with the eyes and his expression changes depending on where you hover over the screen... And he smiled when I hovered through the "Quit to desktop" button. Even the main character agrees that you're supposed to quit this game. Clearly the devs could have done a lot better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011596215', 'num_games_owned': 1637, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1446680125}
review:
TLDR: Wer Gefallen an Tower/Base-Defense findet und Spiele mag, bei denen der eigene Skill einen gut voran bringen kann, dem wird dieses Spiel wohl gefallen!

-------------------------

Dieses Spiel hat mir sehr viel Spaß gemacht! Ich habe es mir relativ "zufällig" heruntergeladen, gestartet und dann hat es mich direkt "gepackt".

Im Spiel steuert man den Charakter "Brad" dem eine Armee folgt, die man sich selbst zusammen stellen kann (beispielsweise: Bogenschützen, Magier oder Octodad). Die Einheitengröße der eigenen Armee hängt von Upgrades ab, die sich im Verlauf des Spiels freischalten lassen. Allgemein lässt sich so ziemlich alles im Spiel upgraden - für mich ein Pluspunkt!

Mit seiner Armee soll Brad den Base-Kristall (ganz links auf der Map) vor den Gegnern beschützen, die von der rechten Seite der Map kommen. Um die Base zu verteidigen muss sich Brad diesen Gegnern also stellen - und deren Angriffen im besten Fall ausweichen um nicht zu sterben! Brad selbst kann zwar nicht angreifen, aber er kann seine Armee mit verschiedenen Verstärkungen unterstützen (Mehr Schaden, mehr Lauftempo oder höhere Verteidigung). Doch diese Buffs sind - so wie seine Armee - nicht umsonst. Sie kosten Noten, welche Brad durch das Spielen auf seiner Laute oder im Verlauf einer Spielsitzung bekommt - ein sinnvoller Einsatz ist also gefragt!

Ebenfalls bietet das Spiel mehrere Modi:
• Story mit 4 Bossen und mehr (lasst euch überraschen)
• Survival (Überlebe so lange du kannst!)
• Escape (Versuche so weit zu laufen wie möglich)
sowie zwei Schwierigkeitsstufen (Normal und Insane)

Ebenfalls gefällt mir der Humor der Entwickler (Ein Beispiel dafür ist die Achievement "360noscopeblazeit") und allgemein das Gesamtpaket.

Die gerade einmal 4 Bosse hören sich zwar wenig an, jedoch wird es - wahrscheinlich - ein wenig dauern, bis ihr dorthin gelangt. Entweder es scheitert an der Zusammensetzung eurer Armee oder an eurem Skill :P

Klingt gut? Ist es auch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119036307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1694819495}
review: great game will get 10+ hours out of it if it gets updated more then will prob be my favorite game of this year

author: {'steamid': '76561198141499183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1446519425}
review:
詳しい内容については他の方のレビューを参考に。
ここでは不満点を述べます。

主人公も味方も耐久度が紙なので、
味方の隙間を縫うように飛んで来た攻撃で主人公が即死したり、
貫通系の攻撃で味方が一瞬で壊滅したりします。
どれだけ順調にウェイブを生き残っても、一撃で終了することが多いので、
そういうのが苦手な人は避けたほうがよいかと。

後半は弾幕STGのようになりますが、
味方の攻撃も敵の攻撃も、色に統一性がなくてカラフルなので、
敵の攻撃なのか味方の攻撃なのか区別ができなくなります。

また、小〇やゲ〇など、下ネタ要素も多いので、そういうのが嫌な人は注意。

セールで１５０円だったので、一応おすすめしておきますが、
８００円となると微妙なところです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097184661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1448215700}
review:
Joguinho simples e é parecido com tower defense se você olhar pelo lado que tem que defender a cidade das waves de inimigos, mas tem que sair se movimentando pela tela para fazer isso, muito divertido.

Simple game, similar to tower defense once you have to defende the town from the enemy waves, howerver you have to move around, very good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091074270', 'num_games_owned': 954, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1486243896}
review:
Stavo sfogliando le pagine del negozio di Steam quando ho notato questo gioco. Apro la pagina e due secondi dopo dico: "DEVO COMPRARLO!". Così l'ho comprato (dato che era pure in sconto) e ho iniziato subito a giocarci.

Premetto che non ho ancora finito la modalità storia (ho appena sconfitto il boss del mezzogiorno) e che qundi una volta finito modificherò (se necessario) questa recensione.

Il gameplay è simile a quello di un comune tower defense, ma  in questo caso l'eroe (Brad) non fa danno direttamente, bensì aiuta le sue "truppe" con gli assoli della sua ""chitarra"" (non è una chitarra, ma non saprei come descriverlo). Non è facile, sopratutto all'inizio ma una volta capito il meccanismo si riesce ad andare avanti più facilmente. I boss e alcune truppe speciali sono più difficili da sconfiggere. Mi piacerebbe avere più di 3 personaggi in quanto come detto precedentemente il gioco diventa sempre più difficile.
Mi piace molto la varietà dei personaggi e anche che alcuni di essi appartengano ad altri titoli (octodad, il personaggio di super meat boy, etc).
La grafica è ben fatta.

Adesso veniamo a un punto MOLTO importante per questo gioco: la soundtrack.
Una parola: FANTASTICA! 
La musica rock si adatta alla perfezione in questo videogioco, rendendo il gameplay meno noioso.

Che dire, ve lo consiglio!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026814004', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1599487634}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011533232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1446219097}
review:
This is a flash game, and not a very good one, AND you have to pay for it. It's not worth to pick it up even if it's on sale. Just go on Kongregate and play games that are much better AND FREE. 

Why is it bad?

1. The pacing. It's pretty tough untill you get Wizards, a cakewalk afterwards. You don't need to use other units.
2. The GRI-I-I-IND. There's a ton of grind in this game, and it's not even satisfying. You grind for gold, you spend it on upgrades. And there's no visual difference between a maxed out unit and a lvl 1 unit.
3. Isn't that enough?

DON'T. BUY. IT. It's a shitty timewaster, there are better ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043346855', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 630, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1494128549}
review:
I originally loved Bardbarian for its humor and deep skill tree, but it ended up being too simplistic in a lot of ways.  Graphics, music, and sound are all subpar, and gameplay involves trying to avoid projectiles with a swathe of party members you can't really control.  The formula also involves a grind to become powerful enough to get further.

Overall, this wasn't enjoyable for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042579840', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1494648020}
review:
Tower Defense, temática medieval, boa trilha sonora, jogabilidade igualmente decente e upgrades estilo rogue like são os pontos fortes de Bardbarian.
Se você gosta de jogos com as características citadas, com certeza não irá se arrepender.
Apeas de ser um jogo casual, o game consegue te prender por horas.
Super recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004581037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1433698666}
review:
A fun little game where your offense lies in your allies rather then yourself. 

   I got to say, I love the premise of this game. Being D&D player for many years, I've always seen Bards get the short end of the stick. This one puts the bard center stage at the heart of the party in a funny action-packed way. Lots of dodging, explosions, death, and all in a nice little pg-13 package. 
   Gameplay is good, though I've only played Bardbarian on PC. The wealth of party members make for some interesting combinations, giving you a lot of leeway on play style. It's a simple, straight forward game that can give you hours of entertainment.

   Not real complaints on this one oddly enough. Thoughrolly enjoyed this one from start to end. Even managed to clear all the achievements, which almost never happens with me.

   Bardbarian is definetely one to add to the library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031582331', 'num_games_owned': 6781, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1561626020}
review:
7min of gameplay
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6H54Tuvvcpo

5/10 tis cute

This game is like a action rts.
Your main character does not attack but can summon or rally his troops.
He has a little racoon pet that can be upgraded to fetch things like gold or items from the town folk.
You pick 3 out of up to 15 classes to take into battle to summon them and help you fight.
Bard will slowly gain notes over time or they can be dropped from enemies.
These are used to call in a unit or to use 1 of the 3 buff that will increase your party's attack, defense, or speed.
The villagers and fort can also be upgraded so they give you items and add defenders to your fort.
In the main story you play through 4 sets of 5 levels with the 5th always being a boss (there is also a days 2).
In Survival enemies and friendly units will randomly spawn on the board and you try to see how long you can stay alive without any bard powers.
In escape mode you have no bard powers and try to see how far you can get wile avoiding poison pools, enemies, & there shots.

Overall its not a bad take on rts games and the units do vary and will change your play style depending on who you bring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106810138', 'num_games_owned': 2232, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1425138611}
review:
You are a barbarian that is tired of pillaging and wants to be a bard instead.
So, Bardbarian. The entire backstory is there in the title.

Unfortunately this new devotion to music and abhorrence of inflicting violence could not be timed worse, since an invasion force of monsters is approaching the quiet town you live in.
Why? Nobody knows. There is no plot beyond the setting.

This leaves the town in a pickle though, without the barbarian they will need another way to protect their town.
Despite no longer fighting directly the Bardbarian has decided to help. The local adventurers' guild has plenty of warriors around and all they need to join the defence is some encouragement. Musical encouragement.

So the Bardbarian runs around the battlefield, playing (monotonous but fun) music to gather a resource called Notes. These notes can be spent to recruit warriors from the adventurers' guild who will start following you around the battlefield, attacking any enemies that come close.

This turns the game into a defence game, you navigate your group of adventurers around the battlefield to keep the monsters away from the town square where a magical crystal does... something important, apparently. Wave after wave, until you get a boss fight and move on to the next segment of the game and do it all over again.

After your almost inevitable failure you spend the gold you earned from the enemies the adventurers have vanquished to upgrade... quite a lot of different things. Upgrade your units, unlock new units, upgrade your own stats, research spells and facilities around the village that make your time just a bit easier.
A weird item that you can buy is the Golden Guitar, which doubles all future Gold income. It's a relic of the time where the game had a cash shop on mobile, but fortunately it can be bought with regular currency in this Steam version. You should do that as soon as possible.

All in all the game gets a bit repetitive as it goes on, and some of the later units are so much stronger than the other ones that you don't really feel like you're customizing so much as levelling that one unit until you get past the level you're stuck on.
However, it's a pretty game with a lot of content and a solid soundtrack.
Recommended if you're looking for a fun defence game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025003274', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1465896609}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998177676', 'num_games_owned': 4911, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1438390078}
review:
A bit hard to classify this game closest would probably be bullet-hell, except without you firing back as your hired NPC henchmen do that for you, with a touch of RPG and Rogue to finish it off. The cocktail is surprisingly good.

You can get notes (resource) by killing some foes, a certain unlockable structure and by standing still (generally ill-advised). With this you can then hire your henchmen, stronger ones unlocked as you proceed through the day (read: levels) and of course the more powerful the more costly. Upon dying you can use the second resource (gold) to permanently upgrade yourself or your henchmen.

It also comes with 2 minigames (to help gather some gold, both also unlock a henchman), one a running (just prevent getting hit) which is the least fun one IMO and a 'survival' mode where you randomly get henchmen to you with increasingly difficult enemies, which is a little more fun. But the best fun is of course gotten from the main game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009813290', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1556406187}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986074665', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1447279275}
review:
Ein sehr simples Spiel,man rennt durch die Gegend und hält die Monster davon ab den Kristal zu zerstören , dabei erzeugt man Gold das benötigt wird um sich Upgrades zu kaufen,die werden auch benötigt um spätere Level überhaupt zu schaffen

Wir selbst sind ein Barde der mit Musik die Truppen unterstützt uns laufen 3 Einheiten,später 7 Einheiten hinterher die gegen die Monster kämpfen dabei geht es dann darum sich nicht treffen zu lassen,also bleibt man am besten immer in Bewegung.

Man arbeitet sich immer weiter vor in den Levels die zwar immer am selben Ort sind aber die Monster die uns angreifen ändern sich,es gibt auch Bosskämpfe,unsere Stadt können wir auch ausbauen was sehr witzig ist so rennt dann zb ein Betrunkener durch die Gegend der auf den Boden kotzt ,Gegner die da durch laufen werden langsamer und später werden sie auch noch geschwächt dadurch.

Für den kleinen Preiß erhält man ein paar Stunden Spaß,es gibt 3 Spielarten Story,Endlos und Überleben,sorgt also etwas für Abwechslung.


Wer Englisch kann (Grundkenntnisse) stellt das Spiel lieber auf Englisch,die Übersetzung ins Deutsche sieht nämlich aus wie mit Googletranslator gemacht

Kleiner Tip

Am leichtesten ist es wenn man erst einmal eine Einheit auf +2 oder +3 bringt (+2 langt aber) und sich noch das Stadthaustier kauft auf Stufe 1.
Damit schafft man dann locker die ersten Level und auch den ersten richtigen Boss,das macht man 2-3 mal und man kann sich die Goldene Gitarre ( 5000 Gold ) kaufen mit der ausgerüstet erhalten wir 100% mehr Gold und unsere Einheiten leveln schneller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119714199', 'num_games_owned': 1747, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1455468562}
review:
VALHAAALA!!!

Esse bárbaro, é insano, faz uma espécie de Air Guitar com um machado! hahaha
E os recursos do jogo? Você tem um bêbado que vomita no chão, para diminuir a velocidade dos oponentes.
O sistema de jogo é simples, você apenas corre, mas seus aliados atacam enquanto te seguem.

 Os personagens: você tem a enfermeira, o arqueiro, o mago, o guerreiro e outros personagens que você pode desbloquear ao longo do jogo, como o grande meat boy de Super meat boy, ou o octodad de Octodad: Dadliest Catch.

Você pode reforçar seus ataques com solos de guitarra, ou defesa e velocidade, e precisa proteger sua base que é uma espécie de jóia gigante!

Lembrando que essas melhorias, são skills.

Recomendo se pagar pouco, pois é bem divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000713888', 'num_games_owned': 960, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1441535536}
review:
Хорошая игра жанра  Tower Defence, в которой башни бегают вместе с тобой. В целом в этой игре есть все, чтобы радовать вас в течение 7-10 часов. Много юнитов, сюжетная линия, поделенная на 4 акта, достижения (кстати, не сильно сложные - я все выполнил не напрягаясь) и дополнительная кампания для хардкорщиков.

Как и JumpJet Rex, Bardbarian отличная игра от студии TreeFortress, ставшей одной из моих любимых.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992886766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1439840960}
review:
Fun little game thats a mix of Tower Defense and Bullet Hell. The gist of the game is you have to defend a town from huge waves of enemies and while you, the Bardbarian, don't actually attack anything, you will summon and buff a large assortment of minions with the power of ROCK! All the while you'll be dodging and weaving through enemy shots as your minions unload hell into the baddies!

From the lightning bolt firing Wizard to the stun hammer tossing Dwarf, you'll find tons of combo choices of units to best suit your style! All sorts of upgrades as well will keep you playing as its rather addicting to unlock and upgrade everything!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136516068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1553366995}

author: {'steamid': '76561197961654296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1433253878}
review:
Un bon petit jeu façon tower-defense avec un côté un peu plus "action" dans le sens ou il faut gérer les déplacements de son héros et du groupe qui l'accompagne. Une bonne durée de vie pour les fans du genre ( le temps de tout débloquer et de tester d'aller le plus loin possible dans le mode hardcore et de faire les hfs il faut bien compter 30 heures de jeu ) et une durée de vie correcte pr les autres : 10 heures gd max pr plier le mode normal ms bon au prix du jeu c'est toujours ca.
En résumé, un bon rapport prix/durée de vie et un concept sympa pr les fans du tower-defense ( meme si on regrettera qd meme qu'il s'agisse d'un simple portage sans trop de modifications ) sinon pour les autres achetez le plutot en promo sinon vous allez trouver l'expérience un peu chère ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198011564736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1439234534}
review:
This is a pretty simple and fun title. You are a bard who builds his team out of warriors, archers, wizards or even mechanical turtles to defend your city. It is attacked by waves of diversified enemies, which gain in power every consecutive day.

While playing different war tunes to raise your team’s attack damage or restore their health points you battle bosses, level up, collect gold and unlock new companions. 

The goal is pretty straightforward: survive until the monsters fuck off, but prepare to farm much gold as the game is rather difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198115366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1449923509}
review: С виду Брэд (главный герой Bardbarian) — брутальный и недалекий варвар со свирепым нравом и огромным топором, но делать выводы по первому взгляду не стоит. За могучим фасадом скрывается творческая и впечатлительная натура, которой в один прекрасный день надоело рубить в капусту монстров, постоянно наседающих на родной городок. Решив полностью посвятить себя музыке, воитель прицепил к верной секире струны и превратил ее в электрогитару. Играет Брэд, само собой, хеви-метал — в конце концов, варвар он или нет?

author: {'steamid': '76561198163052647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1465606951}
review:
[h1] Un juego que te envicia con trampas	[/h1]
Bardabarian es un juego con una premisa simple, algo extraña al principio pero a los pocos minutos le tomas el hilo y entiendes de que va la cosa, con un estilo entre mezcla de tower defense y un sistema de compra rpg uno facilmente se envicia con el juego, el problema viene cuando los enemigos son muy fuertes, el oro muy poco y las mejores insuficientes, esta es una adaptacion de un juego de movil, no dudaria que tuviera la opcion de microtransacciones para poder comprar todo de tiron, sí es divertido, pero es mas estresante que divertido, en resumen te hace jugar un mismo nivel 30 veces para poder juntar el oro comprar las mejoras que creas necesarias, jugarlo de nuevo darte cuenta que esas mejoras no son las indicadas para el nivel y jugar otras 30 para intentar comprar las que si lo son, el juego tiene cromos, si esta en oferta es una buena opcion para jugar a ratos en esos dias muertos oh ratos de ocio, pero no lo recomiendo para tratar de pasarselo al momento pues sera una tarea muy frustrante.
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198015956371', 'num_games_owned': 1392, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1493082585}
review:
A proposta de Bardbarian é simples: Monte sua equipe e vá para a batalha. O jogo se resume em enfrentar ordas de inimigos, parece entediante? não é! Bardbarian é um jogo incrívelmente divertido para se jogar durante alguns minutos e até mesmo horas do seu dia. Você simplesmente não vê o tempo passar, é de fato um jogo viciante.

A magia de Bardbarian está na simplicidade. É muito legal comprar upgrades para sua equipe, desbloquear novos personagens, aumentar o nível de algumas lojas na cidade, aumentar sua equipe e tantas outras coisas. O legal é que tudo isso é executado de maneira simples, não existe complexidade no jogo, é aquele jogo para se divertir. É claro que o jogador vai morrer diversas vezes. Mas isto faz parte da proposta do jogo, já que é assim que você vai coletando ouro e melhorando cada vez mais até passar de determinada parte do qual parecia impossível antes.

Bardbarian não tem definitivamente um enredo, algo é contado no início do jogo e pronto. Vamos para o gameplay.
Os controles são ótimos, a arte é muito bacana e bem feita, o jogo roda super bem em qualquer computador.

Recomendo Bardbarian, é um título casual e muito divertido!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990539789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1236, 'last_played': 1426840519}
review:
This is more like a tower defense game without towers.... 

The core game is... protect your home.
Add new people to your crew to have more fire power.
Get money.... and upgrade yourself as the character that fight with you.
It's a very basic game and very fun to play if you ask me.
There is no multiplayer so singleplayer only.
Controller is supported... I prefure the Xbox 360 controller.

I give it a 7/10 score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033894214', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1438301536}
review:
Jogo viciante!
Comei a jogá-lo ontem e só consegui parar quando o terminei.
Foram 6 horas com um breve intervalo para o lanche.
Jogo muito bacana! Te prende a atenção e a medida que você vai coletando moedas consegue comprar melhorias para os personagens e o jogo mesmo, como a proteção para a torre.
Os gráficos são muito legais, a trilha sonora é boa e a jogabilidade também. E o jogo vai ficando difícil a um nível desafiador que te induz a jogar ainda mais.
As conquistas Steam disponíveis te garantirão ainda mais horas a jogar, mesmo após terminá-lo. Terminei (zerei) o jogo, coletando todos os personagens secretos que estão disponíveis, e ainda assim estou com 68% das conquistas. Agora é tentar completá-lo no modo difícil (+21 years old), que só é disponibilizado após zerá-lo pela primeira vez.

Agora com o modo ainda mais difícil, acredito que para conseguir terminá-lo será necessário pelo menos 1 semana. Isto jogando muito, todos os dias. Dedicando mesmo!
Cheguei a experimentar este novo modo desbloqueado e digo: é tenso! Arrisco a dizer que é 500% mais desafiador do que o primeiro. Nâo é impossível. Longe disso! Mas é uma excelente oportunidade de você se testar técnicamente.
Pode comprar este jogo sem medo! É um ótimo investimento!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057482699', 'num_games_owned': 996, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1437301921}
review:
Un juego bastante sencillo, nuestro objetivo es defender un enorme cristal (joya?) que se encuentra en la ciudad, de las oleadas de enemigos, con cada oleada los monstruos se vuelven más fuertes, por lo que a medida que queremos avanzar tenemos que comprar mejoras para el personaje y el equipo.

El juego en si tiene su punto, aunque no tiene este toque que te engancha, recomendado para partidas domingueras para pasar el rato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194018199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1445264838}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001187390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1437524651}
review:
Petit jeu très sympa, ça se sent que ça vient d'un jeu de portable mais on se prend vite au commande de ce ptit barde qui doit sauver son village.
Que ce soit au clavier ou à la manette, la maniabilité est simple et facile, musique qui peut ennuyer au bout d'un moment, les boss, améliorations et persos à débloquer sont bien cools plus les autres mini jeux proposés.

Bon jeu à tous !

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2594, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1437536570}
review:
Yet another port of mobile casual game where you need cerebellum, not brain.
Only this one is of good sort. While it's not even pretending to be original, this mix is nice from every angle (if you'll not be looking for too long).

You'll be playing for the partygoer who can't fight monsters himself, but good at avoiding hits and making friends. And with help of those friends you'll be defending your village from the onslaught of gremlins, lizards, beholders... and so on. The main catch of this game is that those Bard's friends acts very differently, so you can develop various tactics of the best team around you. Some of those helpers will be taking damage, some - dealing it to the enemies, but it's only for start! An engineer, per example, will be setting shooting towers, so for some time you can play it as basic tower defence game - two engineers in your team can overrun almost everything in the first half of the game! Glory to the engineers!

And glory to the rock music!

But seriously, it's a short break game. It can create some fun, but it's a very simplified game experience. I cannot praise that game highly, despite the fact it is a well made stuff. I'll mark it as 7/10. You surely can buy Bardbarian in some bundle, or with good discount, and spend 3-4 hours of your time. Just don't overdo it. It is mobile casual, and not a chess game. Timekiller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203749841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1437521094}
review: Bardbarian is one awesome game! The units you summon are pretty interesting and offer different skillsets. Though you have to keep earning gold to upgrade your stuff and beat the 20 waves of monsters and bosses. Overall, its worth your time and money especially when its on sale. Enjoy playing!

review:
Finally got my 100%.

Fun game.

If you can handle normal, chances are, you can handle insane mode.

The game is best completed on Insane mode, since you are going to have to complete in on hard mode even after you complete normal mode anyways (For 100% achievement).

Starting on Insane actually seems better, because you earn gold way faster and can upgrade your units sooner than on normal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049924858', 'num_games_owned': 1849, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1434657089}
review:
Одна из проблем стима, что в него начали пихать игры с мобилок, браузерки и другой разный шлак. Вот варвар и добрался с нам с мобильных девайсов.

История легкая и не напрягающая: варвар защищает город от армии монстров. Все. Геймплей соответственно тоже однокнопочный, интересная вариация на версию тавер-дефенса: на миссию (которая тут впринципе одна) берет 3 типа юнитов и можем их призывать в бою. Они будут бегать рядом с вами и атаковать монстров. От вас только требуется уворачиваться, вызывать подкрепление (в случае смерти юнитов), да бафать своих одной из трех песен. И так по кругу. Играете, умираете, получаете золото, прокачиваетесь, играете дальше, получаете новых юнитов, снова умираете, получаете золото, прокачиваетесь... ну вы поняли. Есть еще 2 режима: выживание и забег (последний неплох для фарма золота).

Хотя игра и мобильная, но в целом неплохо затягивает. Но хватит ее ровно на 2 вечера (столько я впринципе и потратил на нее) и то это с учетом задрачивания ачив. На мобиле я б наверно и то меньше играл, игра просто страдает от однообразия. В стимовской версии добавили 3 новых юнитов известных игр, впринципе все отличия. Если вам нечего играть или вы ждете выход игры, то эта игра самое то, убить пару вечеров не более

author: {'steamid': '76561198136249112', 'num_games_owned': 586, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1446559927}
review: I really enjoyed this game. I like games where you can grind gold and other stuff and then upgrade your units, hero, town... . It is short but good, just like games should be. In the game itself you have to protect your town crystal and try to not die. You have to fight the incoming waves of always getting stronger enemies. What I also like is that you can fairly achieve all of the achievements to get the 100%. I strongly recommend this game, especially because it is not that fame.

review: et bien voila un nouveau truc sympa !!! c"est fun, speed et addictif a souhait.avec la manette c'est encore mieux .vraiment agréablement surpris. je pensais que le fait que mon perso ne se bat pas ,serait saoulant;au contraire on esquive les tirs ennemis pour protéger nos ptits soldats ,et on peut intervenir avec divers pouvoirs servant a: aller plus vite, étourdir les ennemis et d'autres du genre .très appréciable également l'apparition des boss ;sans oublier la boutique d'amélioration plutot sympa ;le tout  coloré et plutot joli .perso je joue depuis plus de 15ans et ce titre  apporte sa touche personelle super jeu .

author: {'steamid': '76561198006774834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1507736389}
review: I bought this game on sale and I barely payed a dollar for this game. This game is a creative tower defense and it seems like it'd be a fun app but its more then an app for your phone because I dont regret buying this. It is addictive and you can just read any other reviews and the majority agree with me. This is a very fun Game and i am loving it so far and It seems short but its longer then some games ive played. Infact the game goes on for ever there is always something to do and you can challenge your friends to be better then you or beat your score on certain gamemodes. I recommend this game while its on sale and while its not. Worth buying 9/10

review:
식물 대 좀비 랑 비슷한 느낌입니다.
하지만 게임성이나 재미 측면에서는 식좀에 비해 좀 떨어지고

도전과제를 다하느라 집중해서 열심히 했더니 오히려 
게임의 재미가 반감된 감이 있네요.
한마디로 오히려 도전과제를 잊고 간단히 즐긴다면 더 재밌을듯.

10점 만점에 5점 줍니다.
아주 재밌지도 그렇다고 나쁘지도 않은.. 딱 중간가는 게임이네요.
하실 게임이 없을때 한번 정도 해보기는 나쁘지 않네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036820994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1436799340}
review:
Awsome? Check!
Fast? Check!
Metal? Check!
Grind? Check!

Run, grind, play the lute..äh...axe...äh...kill´em all!


If you like Dungeon Defenders and Brütal Legend this game will provide enough fun to kill your time in an fast paced awesome way.

+simple controls
+likeable soundtrack
+3 diffrent game modes
+funny units
+fast leveling

-soundtrack might get annoying over time due to the fact that only one song is played in a  loop
-missing customizition
-needs a bit more stuff to level up

Fun little game to kill your time with, if you enjoy killing wave after wave of tiny little monsters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202537135', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1675547693}
review:
Не съжелявам че съм закупил играта, мога единствено да похваля производителя и. Играта е страхотна за отбиване на времето, както е лято доста добре се разпуска. Отделно да не говорим че има доста неща за отключване и ъпгрейдване както и цели 22 "значки". Препоръчвам Ви играта няма да съжелявате, поне Аз не съжелявам че съм я закупил!
10/10 Good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023992910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1441463819}
review:
Свои 28р. отбила на 200%. 

Простенько и весело:  бегаешь бардом, за которым носится толпа его товарищей, которых бард суммонит музыкой (читай - маной). Сам бард не дерется, все делают его друзья. Главное - быстро бегая уводить свою команду из под обстрела и врубать вовремя бафы-мелодии. 

Вечер-другой скрасит легко.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1436282026}
review:
Цена конечно адекватная, но я полагал что игра напомнит по геймплею замечательную Army of Darkness, которая, несмотря на мою нелюбовь к Tower Defense в целом - меня затянула в свое время. 

Но похоже я ошибался - не напоминает. Особенно тут удивляют картонные персонажи, и конечно наматывание кругов вокруг врагов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164532340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1449850222}
review: Игра-анекдот о неадекватном персонаже, сочетающем в себе черты обоих архетипов: мускулистый бородач с обоюдоострым топором, вдоль которого натянуты серебряные струны, противостоит ордам гоблинов и прочих классических фэнтезийных злодеев.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045203736', 'num_games_owned': 1583, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1421733856}
review: Picked this up in a bundle.  Eventually loaded it up, and ended up playing through for the next 7 hours.  Reminiscent of older arcade titles, as in addictive for short bursts.  Would not pay the full price for it, but if it shows up in a bundle or prices are slashed, definitely worth an afternoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137065965', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1435859575}
review:
Buy it for cheap, never at full price, here's why:

PROS: 
*it's fun
*cool idea of leveling up attributes, minions, and your town and NPCs
*100% achievements is possible
*diverse unit composition, can try different combos to spice it up

But CONS:
*music (it's the same 45 second tune on loop for the WHOLE game)
*100% achievements possible, but you'll want to punch something doing it
*no replay value past 100% achievement score. there's nothing to do after the 8-12 hour farm
*it's the same thing over and over for the most part

author: {'steamid': '76561198078993075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1455047270}
review:
Fun, easy to understand, awesome riffs on the guitar. I wasn't expecting this much fun. I appreciate the full controller support, I don't think this would be as fun if I wasn't using a controller.

It reminds me of Plants vs. Zombies, with the repetition, and collecting aspects, and also the irreverant humor. I really enjoy both games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009612659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1405119162}
review:
Una suerte de tower defense en que las unidades que invocas pivotan alrededor de tu personaje, lo que lo hace muy rápido y activo.
Hay muchas unidades que desbloquear y mejorar con el dinero que vamos ganando, algo imprescindible ya que tiene tintes rogue-like con una dificultad muy elevada al principio.
Se nota muchísimo el cariño que le han puesto al juego, recomendadísimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040688613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1446875194}
review: "Bardbarian" Is a fun fast paced party shooter with play styles much like a mobile tower deffence. The gameplay is fun and exciting and very fast paced. Some situations can literally put you in bullet hell firestorm adding to the intensity. The upgrading system awesome, their are so many upgrades! There are a few different play styles included in the game, aswell as what seem like an endless gameplay mode after the game is beat bosses and minions double up and become stronger. There are several different kinds of enemy which provides for much diversity. There are also a lot of different kinds of party members to be used that helps make the playing experience that much more unique. Graphics are pretty well done, vibrant good clean coloring. Sound fx are basic, music is fair but i would've loved to hear a more intense sound to the music aspect but eh. Pretty fun addicting game and well worth the play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198103088201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1434587409}
review:
I usually avoid games with the Tower Defense tag, but this one looked interesting and I enjoyed it more than I expected.

I played it on a large screen with an Xbox 360 controller.  The game was well-suited to living room play and I'd recommend playing it that way if you can.

The variety of units is good and allows some customization of your party.  You start with basic units like an archer and a brawler, and can unlock more specialized units like healer, tank, ninja, etc.  All of the units I tried seemed like they would be useful in the right circumstance.  My favorite was the necromancer - she raises the dead, who can be used as an unwilling meat shield in front of your party.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007817556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1566480859}
review:
[h1]Kid-Friendly:[/h1]
Yes. Get them to help you solve the puzzles. Let them feel like champs!

[h1]Kept/Removed:[/h1]
KEPT. A game definitely worth your time and money especially if you are a puzzle platformer enthusiast.

[h1]Good/Bad:[/h1]
Another Perspective teaches you how it’s world works slowly and beautifully which is an one of the tying elements that helps this game belong in your library. Although a relatively short game, due to the fact that completed the main game not over an hour in one sitting, it is still very satisfying – the hook is there and it will keep you hooked until you solve your way through.

[h1]Last Thoughts: [/h1]
It reminded me of Braid a lot due to its overall vibe. And then with the swapping system, it felt like a Mario & Luigi game, which is a good thing to feel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027483587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1433814369}
review:
This is an incredibly fun game. To me, it feels kind of like a blend of Binding of Isaac/Robotron type 'bullet hell' mixed with tower defense. You move the Bardbarian around but he doesn't actually do any attacking himself. You have sidekicks (of different types) who follow you in a tight formation, doing the attacking for you. You move around, helping the group avoid bullets and enemies, playing songs (in true Bard fashion) to inspire their attack, speed, and/or defense. 

It's really quite a clever way to make an action game where you truly play as a Bard. I only have 2 hours in right now, but I know there will be many, many more put into this gem.  Here's some gameplay footage: https://youtu.be/1JgrTIfzlK8

author: {'steamid': '76561197974183287', 'num_games_owned': 930, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1423752949}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062822964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1433815355}
review:
Bardbarian is a fun little game that dips into fingers into many genres of gaming for a nice mixture. Featuring elements of RPG. bullet hell, and tower defense we get a near perfect mixture.

The gameplay is to protect your gem from waves of enemies. Your character doesn’t do the attacking however, he has a magic guitar he plays and has the ability to summon an army of characters to fight his battles for him and follow his every footstep. He also has the ability to cast spells like protect him, make him army stronger or speed him up as well. With a wide cast of unlockable characters it does add replay value trying to create the best lineup you can to progress forward in the game.

It’s a simple game to play and will only take a few minutes to learn all there is you need to know. The graphics are catoonish and fit perfectly and the music does a fine job as well with what is going on. Control wise it’s smooth and I never had any issues during game play with it.

You can breeze through the game in a few hours but thankfully the replay value does make you want to come back for some quick sessions here or there.

For having one map and a very simple premise Bardbarian turned out to be a fun small game to kill time on. I recommend it to most fans of any genre the game lends itself to.

 

Score :

 

8/10

http://apocalypticdemise.com/2015/05/31/bardbarian-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561197986287382', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1417905965}
review:
Na tuto hru jsem narazil úplnou náhodu a musím říct, že mě mile překvapila. Určitě zde nehledejte žádný propracovaný příběh nebo dechberoucí grafiku. Ale ne vždy jsou tyhle věci podmínkou k dobré hře :) Jedná se o hru ve které se snažíte ubránit svou vesnici proti vlnám nepřatel, které jsou vždy zakončený final bossem. Z nepřátel padají goldy a za ně si kupujete  různá vylepšení počínaje jednotkami, vylepšením vesnice až po schopnosti samotného hrdiny (rychlost,velikost skupiny, atd). Obtížnost a počet nepřátel se samozřejmě stále zvyšuje a na konci hry už by mohlo jit někomu i o nervy :) Bohužel herní doba nepřesáhne více než pár hodin a proto je zde HARDCORE mode a CHALLANGE mode, takže si hru můžete o nějakou tu hodinku prodloužit :). Plus pokud sbíráte achievementy herní doba se Vám ještě o něco prodlouží.Pokud je hra ve slevě určitě se vyplatí koupit a na pár nudných hodin zabaví a odreaguje. Nic víc bych zde ale nehledal.

[h1] Plusy	[/h1]

+ Achievementy
+ Sběratelské karty
+ Velký výběr jednotek
+ Challange a Survival mode
+ Dobrá hudba
+ Cena
+ Hezká kreslená grafika
+ Jednoduché ovládání

[h1] Mínusy	[/h1]

- Krátká kampaň
- Pro někoho velká obtížnost
- Po chvíli hraní stereotyp

[b] CELKOVÉ HODNOCENÍ 6/10	[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198017271295', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 483, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1420069507}
review:
Vous recrutez et dirigez une escoude de différents guerriers qui va automatiquement attaquer les ennemis se trouvant à portée et qui déboulent par vagues. 

Au début, on essaye de tirer partie des différentes classes, on pense qu'il y a de la stratégie, mais en fait non. On finit par se faire une équipe entière de "chevaliers qui lancent des épées" (je sais plus le nom) et on se contente d'esquiver les attaques. 

Le genre de jeu à la con qui repose sur un schéma ultra répétitif basé sur le farming de ressource (des pièces), l'achat d'upgrades et ainsi de suite. Comme d'habitude, une fois la boutique d'item totalement vidée, on désinstalle le tout et on passe à autre chose. Un peu débile mais fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015171654', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1711496981}
review:
This is what D&D is missing. A Barbarian turned Bard that gets units to fight for him by playing sick riff after riff on his sweet axe. 

It's a fairly simple and repetitious game. Bad guys come in waves to try and attack the town crystal while you and your units try to defend it. You use notes to summon units as well as power ups and can collect them and coins from fallen enemies. This is a whole day affair and is broken up into parts. For instance if you completed Morning but died or needed to quit the game, you can skip that phase the next time you play and go on to Afternoon. You can also buy upgrades that will help you achieve victory like a town drunk that spews on the ground to help slow enemies or better barracks and colleges for your units so when they come out of them, they are a higher level and will do more damage. However, you can only buy upgrades after each death or else the coins you collected will disappear. This goes for unused notes as well. 

It's a cute game, a little frustrating, and a great time killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056407410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1433262483}
review:
Un jeu qui change des tower defense classiques, sur un rythme plutôt entrainant.
On invoque nos alliés en naviguant entre les tirs adverses.
On peut booster a peu près tout quand on a l'or disponible (et la hache qui double les gains surtout).

Pas mal d'unités disponible pour finalement que 3 places dans les choix, et les unités cross overs ne sont pas traduites.
Et je pense que la durée de vie est limitée, mais c'est quand même un "oui" pour ma part.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013005714', 'num_games_owned': 6683, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1432338910}
review:
很不错的动作加TD类型的游戏，美术风格比较大众化，兵种和技能要素也比较恰当。
但是地图好像太大了一点？而且小兵指挥跟着走，近战小兵还必须贴很近才会生效。
从总体来说，这是一个不错的游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198016179939', 'num_games_owned': 2437, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1432305943}
review:
In Bardbarian, you play as a barbarian whose dream is to become a famous hard rock bard. As such, you hang up your axe and arm yourself with an, um... axe, and enlist the help of your friends to battle alongside you to protect your town. 

This game is really cute and there is loads of replayability with there being several different game modes as well as two levels of difficulty. 

The graphics are cartoony, with the animations well done, and even though it's all set in the same place, the backdrop doesn't seem to get boring. 

I highly recommend this game if you want something to do for half an hour or so at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980259241', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1429382633}
review:
My wife bought this for me and surprised me with it while I was feeling crummy. It was definitely a pleasant surprise. Allegedly, she got it for around $1.00, so the stakes weren't high if it turned out to be not the best. I will say that it was absolutely worth $1.00, but I'm not sure if its worth almost $10. I got every achievement except one by playing for less than fifteen hours. Doing so involved beating the game on both difficulties (Insane and Normal). Maybe if it had multiplayer (though I'm not sure what that would look like), it would have more replay value, but I pretty much played it to completion. 

I really enjoyed it, so I even went back and beat it with a couple different team configurations than I did the first two times. After doing so, though, it does start to get repetitive (especially the music, which is good, but can grow to be annoying after multiple hours of play). If you can get it for five bucks or less, I'd recommend it.
