author: {'steamid': '76561198031725194', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1404996101}
review:
Bardbarian "is a mixture of Tower Defense, RPG & RTS with some 'Shmup and Snake elements". I have no clue where the RTS element is.

It's essentially a game about defending your town crystal from incoming waves of enemies. How do you defend it? You summon party members with different abilities, and you run around dodging bullets and buffing your party (you do not control your attacks, that's all done automatically).

When I saw this game, I thought it looked interesting enough to give it a go. The reviews were surprisingly positive, so... why not?

I'll just say that I was extremely disappointed with this game, and the reviews are unbelievable. I honestly don't know why people think this is a good game of PC! Here's a more lengthy analysis.


First off, [b]presentation[/b].
The [b]graphics[/b] look a bit average to me, but they're fine. What you see is what you get (from the screenshots). One problem with it, is that it's highly repetitive, even visually, since you have only one map for the campaign. And it doesn't really change its look. Other modes have different maps, but nothing beautiful or interesting. 
They're [b]fine[/b]. That's all I can say about it.

The [b]music[/b] was actually not bad. It's almost neo-classical metal, instrumental only. Unfortunately, there's only one song on the campaign. The song loops the entire time, which can (and does) get repetitive after listening to it hours on end. The song loops pretty seemlessly, so that's good (from what I could tell). It was just background music, didn't really add to the experience. 
There were no volume sliders either. Only music/sound-effects on/off.
[b]Very limited[/b] overall. A bit more effort and it could have been much more enjoyable, but playing the same track over and over and over... not good.

The [b]interface[/b] was fine. The mouse support works fine on the menus. I played the game with a Gamepad and it worked well as well, so good job on that. Unfortunately, the concept of an Options Meny seems to be very foreign to the developer. There's barely anything, which is really annoying. But hey, at least it had rebindable keys!
It's.. again, fine. Nothing noteworthy here, it's missing a bunch of options, but it didn't really prove to be a problem, in my experience.



So, how's [b]gameplay[/b]?
Well, it's a grindfest. Almost a waiting game...
As I said, you don't actually attack. So, your whole job is to summon party members, and run around the map, getting close enough for your party to attack. You can also boost the party with +Attack, +Speed, +Defense, or a special Stun ability. If your party member dies, you'll have to summon them again, at a cost. If you Bard dies, or your Crystal is destroyed, you lose. Simple enough. 

To summon units and use buffs, you'll need to gather "Notes". You gain a few over time, and you get some more from enemy drops, sometimes.
And that's pretty much it, as gameplay. 
Enemy variety was pretty good. They'll shoot at you, with some of them being faster, some firing multiple shots, in multiple directions, etc. It felt inspired by The Binding of Isaac (in a good way). That's not to say that the enemy variety is even remotely closer. Not at all. There are about 10 different enemies, and some of them are fairly similar. 

So, all you have to do is literally run around, for the most part. And it gets very old, very fast. It's clearly designed as an iOS game... And a lazy one.
It does have some bullet hell elements. And those could have saved the game! But, there's a huge problem with that. As I mentioned, you have units. These run around you. Which means that your hitbox is huge, and very inconsistent. You simply can't do those awesome dodges you would in a bullet hell. There's no way. 
There's an upgrade on the shop for the party to stick closer together, but it barely helps... Everytime you move, they'll stay a bit behind, which would be fine, but it provides nothing of worth! It simply inutilizes most of the dodging. Which means that you'll always play safe, run around, not feeling like a badass.
That's all the gameplay is. Running around. 
The Boss fights were significantly better, but still not very good. A few simple patterns, but they at least felt more refreshing.

The second part of this game, is the upgrading system. The game is structured with 4 times of the day, each with 5 levels (a Boss Fight in the 5th). Once you beat a Boss, you can't start from that point after you die, or you can go back to the beginning. This could have been fine, but it isn't.
The upgrades are absolutely necessary. It's literally impossible to make any progress without upgrading everything. And that's usually how games go, but this is different. Your progress is 95% affected by your upgrades. There's no skill involved. It's a question of either having enough damage, or not having it. Even if you're a good player, you'll simply be overun by enemies that will rush you crystal. Once you die, there you go upgrade some more, and then beat it easily. And that's the whole game. The upgrades aren't at all interesting. 
[b]They're just that, upgrades. More damage, more health, more speed, more money, more notes, etc.[/b]
This makes for a very, very stale game. You're always doing the same thing! Running around, collecting gold so that you can buy more upgrades, until you reach the end. There are no deep mechanics to learn or master, no strategy, no anything. 

The only glimpse of strategy, is choosing your units. You'll unlock different units throughout the game, with different abilities. There's a huge problem with it, though. First off, some of them are pretty much useless. They're not helpful at all, so there's no point in even existing. The other problem, is unit upgrades. 
You can upgrade them too (see it as levels, basically. higher level=better version of the unit, simply that). BUT, if you want to test a unit, and see if they're any good, you'll have to upgrade them to the same level that your other units are. Otherwise, you can't compare them very well, can you? But, to upgrade them, you'll waste gold, that you only want to use in a unit that you know will be useful. And this is where the system falls apart. 

To try the unit, you'll have to waste gold already, otherwise, there's no point, as they'll be incredibly underpowered. This makes it a waste of gold (which equals to a waste of time, as your play time is simply to collect enough gold to make progress!). [b]It's broken and pointless[/b]. This leads to a very limited cast of characters. I stuck around with most of the initial ones because of it. And I've done fine. Different characters could interact differently, but when the gameplay is literally just running around, it makes almost no difference! You don't play with the characters, they play themselves.



To its credit, there are 2 other game modes. One is just survival, in which you get a random unit spawn that you must collect, and sometimes food (healing). There are bosses, from time to time, and the enemies will try to kill you (no crystal this time).
The other one is an infinite runner mode, you a few stationary enemies (pretty much towers), and randomly spawned obstacles. Both of these modes unlock 2 cross-over characters, so you are encouraged to try them out.
The achievements were... meh. Barely anything to encourage you different (and interesting) character combinations, which is a really big miss. They're mostly for beating each Boss, unlocking characters, upgrades, etc. Nothing interesting. And that's unfortunate.


[b]Conclusion[/b]
This game is literally a waste of time. You'll collect gold to buy upgrades and progress in the game. You'll not learn how to master the mechanics the more you play. You won't feel any kind of rewarding sensation whenever you beat a Boss.

The game has potential, but ends up feeling like a lazy iOS game. You'll be entertained for 1-2 hours. Not more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1405028207}
review:
I had a pretty enjoyable experience with this.

It's a mix between a bullet-hell and a tower defense. You dodge enemy attacks, while recruiting "towers"  which will follow you around while shooting back at the enemy, the goal is to protect a building while at the same time not letting your Bard die. 

You can cast a small number of buffs which last a short while to boost your party.

People may disagree with me on this, but it reminds of a lot of Geometry Wars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074197682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1404983493}
review: Yeah this game is pretty rad. I picked it up in a bundle and really recommend it, even at full price RRP it's pretty worth it. As far as tower defence games go, its way up there on the list and deservedly so. Great music, funny gameplay and decent upgrade system with loads of unlocks. Well worth a blast if it's in your library. Controller recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007719464', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1414029670}
review:
Oh por Dios, oh por Dios!
Les juro que a este juego le tenía 0 fe, y solo lo quería por sus cromos, pero me sorprendió para bien, me sorprendió, me sorprendió mucho. Es un juego sumamente adictivo, con toques humorísticos. Es como un tower defense pero mucho más dinámico, con muchísimos personajes para desbloquer, asi también como ir mejorando las habilidades, un juego nada fácil que siempre te pide más. Un plus es el guiño a otros juegos que tiene. La verdad un hallazgo hermoso, más que recomendadisimo !

author: {'steamid': '76561198059481724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1404896873}
review:
Jedna z tych lepszych gier flashowych, w które człowiek gra dla zabicia czasu. Przejście "linii fabularnej" zajęło mi 6h i nie żałuję spędzonego czasu. Gra wymaga zręczności, cierpliwości i odrobiny pomyślunku. Jeśli ktoś naprawdę się wkręci w bardbariana to ma do dyspozycji jeszcze endless mode, wyższy poziom trudności i survival. Zalecam granie na padzie.

Plusy:
+ Oferuje więcej niż może się na pierwszy rzut oka wydawać
+ Grafika (przede wszystkim design)
+ Muzyka (heavy metal)
Minusy:
- Brak choćby minimalnej fabuły pomiędzy bossami
- Sporadyczne błędy utrudniające rozgrywkę

review: Ok Bardbarian is a cute and fun Tower Defence Game!! You play the Bard and you hire little minons to help you kill off waves of attackers.You yourself dont fight, you just run around and let them kill for you :) Its very RPGish there are upgrade you can buy for your minons and for yourself and the town to aid in your defence and attack. Its has very good and clean 2D animations that are pretty well done and cute.The game is very casual also.I say give this one a shot if you like a Action RPGish Tower Defence game!! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041543513', 'num_games_owned': 761, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1583391394}
review:
If you are into bullet-hell, mouse-manipulation, defense, and/or snake-style games, you should really enjoy this game.

I had played a similar style of game on the IOS, and it was super responsive because it was all through the touch screen. The app was very fleshed out.

This game is just as fleshed out, and I have enjoyed playing it thus far.

You play as a bard, so your player character does not actually attack. Instead, you summon support units (ex: archer, fighter, mage; party limit is initially 3 max) who follow you around, snake-style, and attack the closest enemies. In the beginning, you will notice that the party is a little spread out, and this is fixed by upgrading "body spray" in the store. The game is very charming and comical, the art and music is very good. 

Enemies spawn on the right side of the map and make their way toward your town gem on the left. Over time, you slowly gain "notes" that you use to summon units (you can select 3 from you unit pool to take along with you into the levels) and also to trigger buffs like enchanced damage, speed, or defense. 

The upgrading is pretty well fleshed out, as you can upgrade your units, your hero, and the town. For your units, it is basic overall upgrades like health and damage. There are also unlockable characters like Octodad and Super Meat Boy, which is a cute addition. Your hero can upgrade health, party size, party closeness (body spray), and other things. It is critical to upgrade the bard, as once he is dead, your round is over. 

Upgrading the town is crucial as well, as you can unlock things like a town pet who grabs gold for you (allowing you to effectively dodge more enemy projectiles and not worry about disappearing loot), a town drunk who periodically vomits, slowing any enemies that enter the bile radius. Later, you may unlock a high level barracks or college, which generates extra free units to help you in defense of the town.

The game is really, really fun if you like this style of gameplay, and you can easily spend time playing this if you enjoy upgrading to completion.

The controls are very responsive, you can easily play with just the mouse, but I recommend you either use the keyboard (WASD) to move + mouse to trigger skills, or to use the mouse to move and the keyboard hotkeys to summon units and trigger skills. The tutorial is short, skippable, and very helpful. Learning curve is minimal, however, the game is suprisingly difficult in thr beginning - I had thought I was fighting the boss, but it was only the "pre-boss" (indicated by a skull on the minimap. The real bosses come when you move onto a red (vs. blue) square on the minimap. 

Needless to say, I got served very hard.

Give it a try, definitely recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019270397', 'num_games_owned': 4165, 'num_reviews': 732, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1404494099}
review:
Le genre de jeu tower-defense - action - stratégie qui occupe chez le médecin ou pendant un voyage dans la voiture sur un téléphone portable... En revanche pour véritablement jouer sur PC j'ai rapidement trouvé ce jeu ennuyeux. Je m'explique :
- Le fait que le héros ne puisse pas attaquer lui-même est très frustrant.
- Une progression intéressante mais corsée dès le début pour forcer les joueurs à acheter la monnaie du jeu plutôt que de jouer pendant des heures ("business is business !").
- Des graphismes jolis mais ultra répétitifs et desquels on se lasse très vite (on ne finit que par voir le vert de l'herbe !).
- Une bonne musique d'ambiance dans l'ensemble et des riffs de guitare sympas.
- Un scénario original, ultra simpliste mais suffisant.
- Un grand potentiel de jouabilité et de scoring.

Bref, vous l'aurez compris ce jeu ne m'a pas totalement convaincu. Bien évidemment, cet avis est totalement subjectif car libre à chacun après de tester et de se faire son propre avis. Je pense que les amateurs du genre sauront peut être plus apprécier que moi. En tout cas, je crois que c'est important d'acheter en toute connaissance de cause notamment si vous hésitez >> 10/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198058490817', 'num_games_owned': 1492, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1404335780}
review:
What a fun game! 

I am not a tower defense games player, but this one is really good and addictive. You collect gold to upgrade your minions, your city and your hero. It's not really hard and you can experiment with all the different minions what's the best team for you, so high replay value. The more into the campain you go, the more difficult the levels and the bosses are... but it's always  a fair battle. There are also 2 (3) survive mode.
It is possible to get also 100% achievements, if you are into them ;-)

Support the devs that made this little gem and buy it, you will not regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033263509', 'num_games_owned': 2923, 'num_reviews': 569, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1404122899}
review:
Целью  игрока  является  защита  городского  кристалла,  но  не  башнями,  как  этого  можно  было  ожидать  от  игры  подобного  жанра,  вместо  них  управляемый  игроком  герой-бард  будет  рекрутировать  себе  отряд  помощников,  которые  и  будут  истреблять  всякую  разную  агрессивную  живность.  Если  начальный  выбор  сводится  всего  к  трём  почти  стандартным  типам,  то  в  дальнейшем  проходя  кампанию,  мы  получим  в  своё  распоряжение  много  больше  различных  по  функциональности  и  причудливости  наёмников.  Миссия  от  миссии  враги  становятся  сильнее,  но  и  мы  не  сидим  без  дела,  ибо  улучшений  великое  множество  можно  усилить  войска,  героя,  наигрываемые  им  мелодии,  город…  на  худой  конец  купить  себе  золотую  гитару  и  вытащить  из-под  подушки  верного  друга  енота  падкого  на  лут.  Иными  словами  процесс  сводится  к  простым  действиям:  убивать  монстров  сотнями,  собирать  с  них  золото  тысячами,  героически  погибать,  производить  улучшения  и  снова  бросаться  в  бой,  но  уже  чуть  более  подготовленным  и  так  до  победного  конца,  а  потом  и  дальше  покуда  не  надоест.

Плюсы:  занятная  механика.

Минусы:  короткая.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024348110', 'num_games_owned': 2201, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1404023024}
review: Fun little defense game. Definitely worth a few sessions. Kinda feels like a light version of Orcs Must Die. Basically you play until you get beat, then you use all the money you earned during your attempt to upgrade your guys to make it a little further the next time you try. I recommend an Xbox controller, but totally playable with a keyboard too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079820029', 'num_games_owned': 1026, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1403908774}
review: Jogo muito bom, ótima trilha sonora, controles simples, viciante e dificil. Recomendo vale a pena comprar ainda mais se você gosta de coisas dificies por que este jogo é um deles. author: {'steamid': '76561198000125770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1404569528}
review:
Why protect your town with static tower defense when you can summon classic fantasy classes to follow you around and thrash orcs while you thrash on an epic lute-axe.

It's a classic formula of the inevitable defeat against wave after wave of monstrous enemies that gets easier to progress as you unlock upgrades. [b]Except this time you have face melting guitar solos[/b]. It's like someone didn't mind [i]Brutal Legend's[/i] RTS elements and wanted to make it the selling point of a TDG.

review: This is easily one of the most entertaining games I've played in ages. Mike Gaboury's signature art style brings loads of personality to an already clever, addictive game, and it's easy to lose hours out of my day shredding enemies and wicked riffs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048810826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1405288560}
review:
For a tower defense-style game, it's really not bad. Instead of direct attacks, you command minions to do your damage for you. It's a gimmick, and content-wise the game is shallow. I could easily see a game like this put on AddictingGames and doing quite well. 

The learning curve is fairly tame and the achievements come easily. The only real downside is scaling cost for upgrades; grinding weak monster bosses for hours seems to be the most cost effective way of gaining gold and fleshing out a small game. For a casual gamer willing to spend less than $4, go for it. This game is 5-10 hours of fun, depending on how low your tolerance is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003785049', 'num_games_owned': 4804, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1546467023}
review:
Juego completado al 100%:

Positivo:
-Historia simple y entretenida
-Sistema de leveo tanto para el protagonista como para los personajes
-Similitud con otros juegos flash
-Sencillo de jugar
-Incluye 3 juegos (campaña, supervivencia y kilometraje)
-Tiene trofeos para playfire
-Tiene cromos para vender o sacar insignia y subir niveles

Negativo
-Puede llegar a ser repetitivo
-La banda sonora es buena pero el escuchar la canción una y otra vez puede ser frustrante
-La jugabilidad es muy sencilla

Nota total: 8.3

PD: recomendado para gamers que le gustan los juegos retros o flash minijuegos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981354175', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 1128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1402803474}
review:
So this game is pretty simple. You're some buff barbarian and you decide to be a rockin barbarian. It's very simple and costs a meager 7 bucks.

In this game you will protect the crystal on the left from the dudes coming from the right. Everytime you fail you will be given the oppurtunity to upgrade your stuff. In general this is the entire game. You kill things, get gold, get further, die and upgrade. It's not a bad game if you enjoy this and I found it fun for a bit, but it doesn't hold a lot of variety. It also doesn't help that the metal knight dude is full on OP and makes variety a joke. I'm also not a fan of the fact the healer kills herself to heal your units. That makes them somewhat worthless.

I'd still recommend the game as something to mess around with, but I would not recommend it for serious play. It's also got a survival mode where you try to live as long as possible and a mode where you run along and try not to get touched by anything, but 7 bucks is stretching it for this. 

Average game I would say.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983225082', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1404781114}
review:
I thought I would change my review mainly because I looked at my play time for this game and I found I played it a lot more then I thought I would. The game is easy to pick up and play and does feature a long list of good guys to help you out after you play thru the game and advance far enough. 

It is a grindy game and could get old if played for a long stretch of time. However I have played the other game mods besides the reg. mod. I wasnt very good but did manage to get some gold out of it. The best and wisest power up to buy would be the *2 gold it does costs a lot but pays for itself very quickly.

I will say that I think I judged the game a little harshley at first. It does have zest to it and the extra characters are very unique. 

I would give it a 7/10 its a good game. Plus I made some money selling the cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058644382', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1446583177}
review:
Bon petit jeu pour pas cher.

Un genre de tourelle defense avec des élements de rpg / rts...

Direct l'intro met dans l'ambiance, un barbare après avoir farmé du mob et mal placé quelques points de craft, se frabrique une guitare a partir d'une hache. De la commence son rêve de musique, mais son village est attaqué; et il doit protéger le crital de ce dernier.

Le jeu se déroule sur une seule journée, découpé en 4 tableaux représentant des moments de la journée. Chacun ponctué d'un gros boss. Votre personnage ne peut pas combattre directement, a la place il peut invoquer des troupes et trois sorts (attaque, vitesse, défense). Les troupes invoquées le suivront et ferront le ménage, et la il y'a un bon choix, les classes se débloquent au fur et a mesure du jeu, pour attendre les 200 possibilités.
Rajoutez a tout ça, de l'or qui tombent après la mort de chaque monstre pour upgrade les troupes, le barbare ou le village. 

De plus on peut atteindre les 100% de succès juste en s'accrochant un petit peu ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197981113118', 'num_games_owned': 1080, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1458509701}
review:
Bardbarian ist ein nettes kleines Indie-Spiel, dass sich nicht so recht in eine spezielle Genre-Schublade stecken lässt. Hat ein bisschen was von Rogue-like, SHMUP und Tower Defense Elementen, aber erfüllt keins davon so richtig. Macht aber gar nichts, denn grade diese Kombination unterschiedlicher Gameplay-Eigenschaften macht das Spiel interessant.
Es ist allerdings kein leichtes Spiel, man stirbt sehr schnell und muss die Levels oft wiederholen um sich Upgrades leisten zu können. Macht trotzdem für ne kleine Runde zwischendurch immer wieder Laune, grade auch wegen dem tollen Soundtrack.

Mehr Details im Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wcf_j85xrgQ

author: {'steamid': '76561198082644724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1401256315}
review:
Изредко одиночные игры затягивают меня так сильно,как эта. С первого запуска,я провел в игре 1.5 часа. Не помню,когда такое было последний раз. Игра хоть и короткая,но очень затягивает. Пожалуй,не стану описывать сюжет и т.д.,а сразу перейду к + и - игрушки.

Плюсы:
+ Хорошая и приятная графика. (Хотя я нейтрален к выбору графики,но здесь она особо приятная).
+ Отличное музыкальное сопровождение.
+ Большой выбор прокачки.
+ Общая прокачка. Например,если вы не справляетесь в кампании,можно пофармить в побеге.
+ Простое и понятное управление.

Минусы:
- Короткая
- Хоть в игре и много юнитов,всю игру (нормал) можно пройти,используя лишь Лучников (в начале),Ниндзя ( в середине) и Рыцарей (в конце,для Босса). В общем смысл в том,что многие юниты просто не нужны.

Лично мне игра понравилась. Всем рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032148943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1406704532}
review:
ギターの力を使ってクリスタルを守るディフェンス型アクションシューティングゲーム。
自分からは攻撃ができないのでギターを使って仲間を呼んで攻撃してもらう。
何度も死んでパワーアップし、wave20を攻略すればクリア。
最初は使えるキャラも3人しかいないが、waveを進めていくことで12人に。
特定の条件を満たすことでさらに3人増え、最終的に15人の中から選べるようになる。
ぶっちゃけキャラごとの差がかなり大きいので固定化することになると思う。
実績全解除も割と楽、値段以上には楽しめた。

難易度に関して、NormalモードとInsaneモードの違いなのだが、
・Insaneのほうが敵の動きが早い、敵の出現が早い、敵の数が多い（？）。一方自キャラの動きも早い。
・Insaneのほうが手に入る金が多い。
・Insaneで始めるといきなり実績一つ解除。
Normalだとたまに敵を早く倒しすぎて待つのが面倒くさいと言うこともあるし、
金が貯まらなくて強化しきれずに何度も同じ所で死ぬということが多く、いらいらする場面が多い。
一方Insaneだとテンポもよく、金が一気に貯まって強化もしやすいので初見でもInsaneから始めるほうが圧倒的にいい。
実際自分もNormalではクリアまで4時間ぐらいかかったが、Insaneだと1時間30分程度で終わった。
このことから、Normalでプレイするのはおすすめしない。

author: {'steamid': '76561198031122224', 'num_games_owned': 2686, 'num_reviews': 382, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1400969232}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009656318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1400425859}
review: 6/10 - In this colourful tower defence game you must protect your crystal as well as your own character - the Bardbarian - against a horde of roaming enemies. To do this, you purchase different kinds of units for protection such as Wizards, Archers, Dwarfs, Ninjas, Healers and many others. Progress for a little bit then die, and use the money that has accumulated to slightly improve a unit. Play again, repeat the process. Then repeat. Repeat. Repeat. This is a fun game, for a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009751191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1396474352}
review: I've had lots of fun with this addicting game! I like how the game gets a lot harder as you progress, but also gives you a lot of options to soften the blow of the next incoming wave of bad guys! Plus, it's like a tower defense game, but not boring. I really think you should check this game out. (Plus, the developers are like super cool peeps!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028220919', 'num_games_owned': 959, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1400753225}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006478062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1570381267}
review:
The game is not that bad... Reminds Plant vs. Zombies a little, or Poof vs. the Cursed Kitty or Zombie Pirates, or even maybe Orcs Must Die and Sanctum - meaning that you must protect your base (here: town crystal) while fighting "personally" and developing new tools of destruction, new defences etc. It's easy to pick up, easy to play but...

CONS:
- really awful, unesthetic graphics
- a game for maybe 3-4 hours (then it becomes boring and very repetitive)
- should and could be better
- looks like a poor mobile port (which it probably is)
- sometimes a little bit too difficult to proceed to the next levels
- this electric guitar sounds get quite annoying after a while...
- I've lost my savegame after a few hours of gameplay
- it's nothing special to be honest

PROS:
- it's easy to pick up and play
- it's funny
- many items to buy
- good for a few hours if you have nothing better to do

VERDICT:
IMO all the games that I've mentioned above are simply much, much better than Bardbarian. After 3-4 hours it became very repetitive and boring. If you're looking for this kind of game I would  rather recommend Poof (with 2D graphics) and of course Orcs Must Die (3D graphics) instead. But this one here is also palyable, so if you have a chance to get on a sale for less than 1 Euro maybe you could give it a try... You shouldn't have huge exspectations though. It's a funny, little game with ugly graphics, but it's good only for a while. Generally speaking: nothing special.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961904441', 'num_games_owned': 2070, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1400444489}
review: Warning this game contains a highly toxic form of RPG, once you have made contact with this strain you will be compelled to play this game over and over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034161846', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1399073677}
review:
Stirring up the real-time strategy and action RPG genres together, with a dash of Tim Shafer's Brutal Legends thrown in for good measure, simmers together the unique game play blend of Bardbarian. The game's "axe" (or lute) wielding hero's tunes give inspiration to the powerful allies you can summon to defend against the waves of foes that want to destroy your town. The action is fast-paced, frantic and loads of fun - there's even a hint of SMUP game play added into the mix. With a difficulty level that's as hard as the game's rock and roll soundtrack, Bardbarian is a title that all hardcore fans should take [i]note[/i] of. 

...and yes, the pun was intended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093433395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1403574927}
review: I heard this game was first on mobile devices which was a huge turn off for me. I got bored the other night and bought it on Humble Bundle Store. If you enjoy tower defense with a mix of RTS then get this game. You are constantly trying to upgrade your Hero, Units, and the town to reach higher waves. Regardless of what you do each wave the enemys have more HP and do more damage which makes it a bit challanging. If you enjoy spending hours grinding away and upgrading then grab this game. I wasn't expecting controller support but was able to play using my wired 360 controller. Starting off I recommend saving up the gold coins you collect and get the golden axe-lute (Gives you 2x Gold drop).

author: {'steamid': '76561197972998984', 'num_games_owned': 811, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1659879141}
review:
Plants vs Zombies meets Orcs must die.

a nice light version of the 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198127825728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1401594235}
review: This game is sooo much fun!!! :)  You basically run around the area summoning different "friends" to protect you while you make it through each section.  Your "friends" will attack for you as soon as you get near enough to any mobs.  It seems deceptively easy to start with but at some point you will fail.... that is where the item shop comes in!!! :)  You can upgrade your hero, the base itself (crystal thing...think Dungeon Defenders! lol) and also you can upgrade your "friends" that you can summon!  This means that even though the game hands you your butt on a plate quite often... you will think to yourself "I'm pretty sure I have a chance now I upgraded that wizard a couple of times" and you will try again.... and again... and again... but you will enjoy every second of it while you retry again and again!  Great replay value here and great fun to load up for a quick 15 minute blast at a time or even to play for hours at a time. ;)  It's very cheap right now (Humble has it for a measly £1.49 (approx $2 to $3) as I write this!) so what are you waiting for? :) Go grab it! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198033268212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1414846331}
review: What a fun, innovative and fresh game! Bardbarian combines elements of TD (such as waves of enemies) and Hack 'n' Slash (you control the main character and can cast spells at command). The learning curve is quite flat, as the controls are easy and promptly explained, but you will need to spent quite some time to unlock everything there is and trully finish the game. Make no mistake, this is not a 'just a couple of minutes' game. Without noticing, you will spend the whole day jamming your way out of those hordes. Bard on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046656549', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1553646109}
review: Screaming Lute, bleeding dudes, and upgradables! I give it give it 5 of 5 chords.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036211076', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1523377031}
review: One of the best tower defense I ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982074343', 'num_games_owned': 1424, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1432257363}
review: It's hard to categorize Bardbarian. It's like a mix of tower defense and roguelike, but the best way to describe it is that it's like Soulcaster. It's your task to fend off waves of invaders, but you don't actually fight. Instead you summon different units who automatically fight for you at your side while you cast buffing spells in true RPG bard fashion. The result is an incredibly fun and addictive gaming experience that lends itself to a lot of strategy due to the vast unit combinations available. It's simple enough to pick up, but has enough difficulty to keep you coming back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051587285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1446161603}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198050805503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1478625712}
review:
lazy ppl scroll to bottom

I very much enjoyed this game and would point any TD fan to this game, def worth the 6.99 i paid for it. It has a GREAT replay value with several different modes to keep people happy, and the story mode has a continuation after you've beaten the final boss. The art style is great and reminded me of kingdom rush, which is probably my fav TD of all time.
I had a few comlaints that dampened its score with me. The first is that even though the units are pretty unique
there is no way to improve anything other than their stats, for instance one of the "towers" that follows you around 
throws 3 glowing (bullets? Rocks? i'm not really sure) and there is no way for you to upgrade to say 4 of them, or make them split when they hit an enemy. The music is classic metal style, but it gets a little repetitive after a while, the solos that brad shreds to summom units and use his powers i think were spot on though Also i found 1 bug and what i think might be 1 more. I had the game freeze up on me once, but when i alt tabbed out, came back in and pressed start the game reponded again. During the game you'll get a pet racoon who goes and picks up gold for you, i had troubles with him actually picking up MORE gold that was dropped and putting it into my coffers from an npc i had unlocked that makes golf for you (i wasnt complaining but i knew it wasnt supposed to be this way). The last thing that i had a comlaint with was the 3 steam only characters "meatstack" (super meat boy), octodad, and shell razer. Over all these characters were INCREDIBLY underwhelming, i was very dissapointed, plus they recycled other units sounds. For example meatstacks shoots tears. . . but they soujnd like the archers arrows, octodad didn't make any sounds at all.

overall 8.5/10

Pro's

Innovative TD game
Has unique units for the genre
LOTs of replayability
Under 10$! VERY much worth it

Cons

music can get slightly repetitive
no upgrades to units actual mechanics, only stats

The game is new so hopefully they will update the game with more bosses, and additions soon. Possibly with some way to upgrade units mechanics  . . . please :c

author: {'steamid': '76561197999950657', 'num_games_owned': 3799, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1398741811}
review:
Bardbarian is first and foremost a game designed and made for phones. It's short, simple and to the point - if you're bored, this game might be worth it.

It's a simple WASD movement game, dodge enemy shots and get a following of your own to take care of the constant onslaught of enemies. 

While I personally enjoyed this game for a couple of hours, I would never recommend that anyone should spend more than a dollar or two on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093850499', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1638082921}
review:
主人公が斧型のギターを使って仲間を呼び敵を倒すゲーム

なんだかスマートフォンのゲームの様に感じられるけど普通に面白い

ゲームジャンルはSTGに近いです
自機が撃てずにオプションに任せるシューティングと言ったら分かりやすいでしょうか

ゲーム上で敵を倒して出てくるコインで町や仲間や自分を強化していくシステム

仲間を呼びその仲間に敵を倒してもらう自分はギターを掻き鳴らし強化や仲間の召喚、弾を避けるなどをする

戦闘に使える仲間は最大で4人まで選べて最大9人まで召喚できる

今はウィザードやネクロマンサーが群を抜いて強くそいつらさえ率先して強化すれば後は楽
だけどユニットごとに特徴があるのでとりあえず使ってみるのも面白い

このゲーム20WAVEまでだけれどもそれが終わったら21WAVE以降が出現
スコアアタックみたいな物で進んだところをスチームランキングに投稿できる

その他にもとにかく生き延びるサバイバルモードや敵の弾を避けて進んでいくエスケープモードなど
もある

そしてインセインモードという難易度が格段に上がるが敵が落とすコインの量がかなり増えるモードもある

買うときに注意してほしい点と言えば
主人公がニキビを潰して膿をバケツいっぱい取ったりゲロで敵を足止めするなど多少下品
こういうのが苦手な人は控えたほうがいいかもまぁどうせすぐ慣れるだろうけど
あと首が飛んだり体が四散するなどグロテスク

それとバグが多少ある
そのステージのボスを倒さないと一時的な効果の強化がずっと続いたり
なにも押してないのになぜか主人公がずっと下に進んで行ったり

でもまぁトレーディングカードにも対応していて英語がわからずとも雰囲気でどうとでもなるので気になったら買ってみたら如何でしょうか

author: {'steamid': '76561198034614210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1403272936}
review:
뭐랄까 여러가지로 좀 미묘한 게임입니다.

기본적으로 게임은 디펜스인데
주인공은 아무런 공격 능력이 없고
곁에서 싸워줄 병사들을 소환하거나 버프 스킬을 걸어주는 게 전부라
뭔가 시원시원한 맛이 떨어집니다.

주 조작이 이동뿐이라 다소 심심하다는 느낌도 들고요.

모바일 게임의 이식작인 것을 생각하면 납득이 가기도 합니다만은
너무 안이하게 그대로 PC로 옮기지 않았나는 생각도 듭니다.

객관적으로 봤을 때 게임 자체가 그렇게까지 나쁜 건 아닙니다만은
PC버전 보다는 차라리 모바일 버전을 추천드립니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015879853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1632289847}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198039743592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1398437540}
review:
Bardbarian eine Mischung aus Tower-Defense und Bullet-Hell-Shooter und erschien ursprünglich für Mobilgeräte. Das Besondere an dem Spiel ist, daß hier die "Tower" Einheiten sind, welche mit dem Spieler mitlaufen. Dadurch spielt sich das ganze eher wie ein Bullet-Hell-Shooter, bloß das der Spieler eben nicht selber direkt angreifen kann. Durch geschickte Plazierung der eigenen Einheiten kann man aber gut festlegen welcher Gegner als nächstes angegriffen werden soll.

Mit dem Gold, welches man in den Leveln verdient kann man jede Menge Einheiten, Fähigkeiten und Gebäude freischalten und aufrüsten. Daher kommt auch ein Großteil der Motivation, man möchte immer noch eine Runde machen um sich irgendwas zu kaufen.

Die Steuerung erfolgt über Maus, Tastatur oder Controller. Das Spielen mit Maus fühlt sich an, wie mit dem Finger auf dem Touchscreen. Man hält die linke Maustaste gedrückt und die Entourage läuft dem Mauszeiger hinterher. Mit Tastatur oder Controller ist das Spielgefühl direkter. Ich empfehle einen Controller.

Bardbarian lief bei mir stabil, Abstürze gab es keine. Wenn man zu einem anderen Programm wechselt, wird das Spiel automatisch pausiert.

Hat man die 20 Level des Hauptspiels geschafft, wird ein Endlos-Modus freigeschaltet. Zusätzlich gibt es noch zwei weitere Modi: Survival und einen Endless Runner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074612987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1397377494}
review: This game is awesome. It's a partial "rogue like" in that you play, die, and the money you make carries over, and can be used to upgrade your town, player, and party. You play as a bard-barian, that doesn't attack, but struns his awesome axe, and calls for varying party memebers (archer, mage, healer, brawler, etc.) and then can strum to add buffs to your party (increased speed, defence, attack, etc.). Great game to play if you want to kill some time and have some fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021296673', 'num_games_owned': 1723, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1398082619}
review:
Bardbarian est le genre de jeu qui a un concept simple, des graphimes minimaliste et simple (mais jolie quand même !), avec un gameplay tout aussi simple et on ne lui  en demandera pas plus parce que c'est cool et fun à jouer comme ça.

On a donc affaire ici avec un jeu mélangeant le tower defense et du rts sans prise de tête. Le but est d'empêcher les vagues d'ennemis de détruire le cristal de la ville et pour empêcher cela notre brave barbare jouera de sa merveilleuse hache/guitare pour appeler des potes ou encore renforcer la team. À noter qu'on peut bien sûr améliorer notre héro tout comme ses compagnons  ainsi que la ville. 

Le gros reproche que je ferais au jeu et c'est dommage car je suis sûr que ça aurait pu être évité, ce sont les nombreux bugs encore présents dans le jeu. Sorti trop tôt ? Encore en bêta mais on ne le sait pas ? Bref je ne sais pas mais c'est dommage car du coup l'expérience du jeu est un peu gâché à noter que les dévoleppeur sont au courant des bugs et bossent dessus pour les corriger mais bon peu importe ce qui est fait est fait. 
Exemple de bugs; impossible d'utiliser la comp éclair (bouton A) tout comme appeler un 4ème perso (lt ou rt + A), des ennemis buggé qui reste sur place sans attaquer, mon équipe qui d'un coup n'attaque plus donc pas le choix que de mourir ou de recommencer... et aussi quelque crash du jeu avec un écran bleu (mais celui du jeu je précise). Je précise que je jouais avec une manette xbox 360 filaire.

+ Fun, un gameplay simple et basique mais accrocheur

- De nombreux bugs...

je mets un 7.5/10 
Un jeu sans prétention qui pourra vous occuper sans problème pendant quelques heures, compter approximativement une dizaine d'heures pour avoir tous les succès.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036200591', 'num_games_owned': 1659, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1397995945}
review: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this game. Plenty of Characters that you can upgrade and use in many different combinations. The action never stops. The fun is endless. You can upgrade your town that helps you out. This game reminds me of a classic arcade game that I would have played when I was a kid. VERY ADDICTIVE. You can play just a few minutes or you can put hours into it. When I saw it I thought it looked fun so I bought it and it is one of my favorite games. It has elements of strategy, tower defense, rpg like upgrades, and a fast paced arcade game. I recommend it to anyone that reads my review and thinks it sounds interesting. It also does not cost much plus they will be adding future levels, upgrades, and possibly characters. A GREAT game I highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991200082', 'num_games_owned': 1592, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1659117539}
review:
Bardbarian is a great game. You fight to survive against waves of enemies while also defending your town. You don't directly attack enemies. Rather, you play as a Bardbarian who shreds on his axe (this 'axe' being an actual axe, not a guitar), summoning other classes to aide you. There are quite a few classes to unlock, each with its own uses. You can level up these classes, and you can even level yourself up in the process. You can even employ the help of the townspeople, even the town drunk.

I highly recommend this game. It's tower defense done right, and I'd argue that even people who don't tend to enjoy tower defense games should give it a shot. It's that good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017831797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1397957374}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076462814', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1397527175}
review:
Really fun and addictive game. Great art work and loveable characters. this game is perfect for when you want to play something a little more casual and different. This game has awesome music, cool boss fights, and unique characters that have their own strengths and weaknesses. The game is pretty easy but some of the later levels can prove to be quite difficult and will take multiple play throughs. Also even when your done with the game you can play on insane mode which unlocks a new character slot and allows you to upgrade each unit once more. You won't take long to beat the regular story mode but there is survival and escape mode that is also pretty fun at times to play. The game play can be quite tedious and repetitive from time to time but I think one can expect that from a tower defense game. Even with the sometimes bland gameplay this game's goods far out way the few bads that it has. I would love to see the game to have a longer story mode or even some short of an adventure mode in the future but the game is pretty much good as it is for a casual tower defense game. 

Pros:
+ Amazing Artwork
+ Unique and hilarious characters that you can unlock
+ Adorable raccoon companion
+ Great soundtrack
+ humorous story
+ Octodad

Cons:
- limited game modes
- Short story mode

Overall:     9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198017091014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1405809262}
review:
If you like games like Rogue Legacy, where you have to try again and again to succeed, with the help of some improvements that you can buy, you will like this game. Every time you fail, you collect gold that will give you access to new content, and you'll be able to go further in the game. My only reproach is that the game is a bit expensive if you consider the content : only one map in story mode, only 20 levels, and only 4 bosses. But if you wait for a little price drop, it should makes you happy and addicted. 

PS : 360 controller highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074846527', 'num_games_owned': 2397, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1400578981}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991776510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1397560605}
review:
This game is a fantastic twist on a simple idea. Unit summoning games, which have similar formats to tower defenses, can often be uninspiring, but Bardbarian steps out in front and slaps you in the face. With its pleasing graphic style, unusual twist on a classic hero plot and simplicity of adjusting to game style, Bardbarian is a must have game. Play time can vary depending on how many achievements you want to pick up, but you can spend as little as five minutes on this game and still have a great time. Survival mode is challenging to even the most hardened player and the Escape style mode is a great way to earn yourself some extra gold while actually testing your reflexes and mental sharpness.

I wholly recommend this game to everyone and anyone, but especially those that enjoy the format of summoning or tower defence games. You may come away with finger cramp, but you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106948947', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1425668436}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000669410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1468171201}
review:
[b]A kite training program.[/b]  Learn how to dodge with your pack of summoned protectors through a bullet hell while trying to protect your crystal.  Good traing for Diablo and many MOOs.

I liked the simple level and play design, enemies come in waves you disptach them with your minions and super powers.  Few buttons make is playable w/a kb/mouse or controller.  It comes with a RPG-lite leveling system to keep it fairly adictive.  

If I'd haven't played a dozen simular games this month, I might have stayed with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007896072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1565180931}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041204592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1438245517}
review: Bardbarian non è privo di difetti ma data la sua natura fa il suo compito: è immediato, intuitivo e sopratutto divertente, riuscendo a mixare un pizzico di strategia ed elementi RPG. Il gameplay è ibrido, tra un tower defense ed un RTS, con una longevità da 5-6 ore ma facilmente estendibile se si vuole potenziare al massimo l'armamentario, intraprendere le sfide o cimentarsi con l'insane mode. Molto carismatico è il tema musicale, mi ha catturato subito. Il prezzo mi sembra esagerato, quindi compratelo se scontato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046915762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1397398676}
review:
[b]RPG/Diffence要素を加えた全方位型見おろしSTG[/b]

[u]総評[/u]
気分転換に数時間は手軽に楽しめた
コミカルなキャラクターも良いし、仲間を召喚・育成できる点も新鮮
個人的にはバンドルで入手した為、満足度は有り

[u]他の全方位型STGとの違いや特徴[/u]
-主人公は支援業務に特化で攻撃は不可、攻撃は仲間が担当
-仲間は近接型、魔法型、特殊型等に分かれた12クラス、1度に連れていけるクラスは3種迄(1週目)、クラスは進行度に応じて順次アンロック
-プレイ中に仲間は最大7人まで召喚可能(1週目)、多人数程DPSは強化されるが被弾しやすい
-WAVEクリアでゲームは進行　朝、昼、夕方、夜が各5WAVEの計20WAVE(1週目)
-主人公のHPが無くなる or 護衛目標のタワーが撃破されるとGAMEOVER
-敵を倒すと
GOLD取得→主人公の能力やクラスのLv、タワーのPerkや各種アイテム等を購入可能
♪取得→仲間の召喚や主人公の魔法に利用
経験値取得→仲間のLvアップ(プレイ時のみ)
-2周目(難易度上昇、強化キャップが拡大)、サバイバルモード、エスケープモード有り

[u]ポジティブ評価[/u]
-主人公がギターを持った蛮族、MEATBOYやOCTDADがカメオ出演していたりと面白味のあるキャラクターデザイン
-戦士や魔法使いを始めとした親しみやすいクラス設定
-強化育成要素　育成(稼ぎ)も簡単、強化した効果もプレイに反映されやすいのは楽しい

[u]ネガティブ評価[/u]
-1週クリア4時間程度のボリューム
-強クラス、弱クラスの差が激しくパーティーが固定化しやすい　その為プレイに工夫のし甲斐が薄い
-敵の種類が少ない

[u]その他[/u]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=248196736]100%実績ガイド[/url]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=245523033]ユニットガイド[/url]
[url=http://www.steamcardexchange.net/index.php?gamepage-appid-269490]カード対応[/url]
[url=http://groupees.com/bm12]バンドル[/url] ※日本時間4月14日(月) 16時迄

author: {'steamid': '76561197993867694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1488817498}
review:
Recomendable. Un pasaratos estupendo. Juego sin historia, un "matabichos" sin parar que solo busca entretener un rato, mas de una partida seguida se hace pesada.

Pros: Entretenido y te pica el poder conseguir mas personajes y mejoras. Graficos sencillos pero graciosos.
Contras: Juego corto y le hacen falta personajes con algo mas de diversidad, terminas siempre con los mismos (ninjas). 

Mi puntuacion: 6,5

author: {'steamid': '76561198021940873', 'num_games_owned': 9526, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1397217459}
review:
[table]
   [tr]
        [th][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33501916/]Follow my curator for more great game recommendations![/url][/th]
   [/tr]
[/table]

Bardbarian is a tower defence game with a unique twist, the towers are attached to the main character and you steer them around the battlefield to take out the creeps.

	There are elements from many games here, the lane approach of Plants vs. Zombies, the grind and slowly improve of many IAP games and even playing guitar riffs like in Brutal Legend to buff your group.  The cartoon graphics are beautiful and the various towers look great.

	You troops come in many familiar variants, from glass cannon ninjas to de-buffing Shaman to front line tanks and healers.  There are even some familiar faces from the Indie world that make an appearance!  There is a decent amount of strategy in the choice but you can only bring 3 types of towers at a time, I can't help but think if this limit was relaxed it would have provided a more interesting game.  It is increased to 4 after you complete the game once but still...

	You can be constantly on the move, attack from angles with high damage low health units to attacking front on with the tank taking the damage while shooing down lanes or even some variation thereof.  I used a front line of ninjas with shamans and an engineer to provide support.  Looking around there does seem to be a nice variation of viable builds, a definite plus!

	The grind is the biggest issue here and shows the games IAP roots.  Taking out IAP and just making the game paid for the PC market does not a great game make, it seems as though the grind is the primary game mechanism at times, not fun.  There is only one map in the main game and even though every 5 levels out of the the total of 20 the time of day changes and you get a unique boss, there is no discernible difference apart from slightly different creeps.  There are a couple of other modes, survival where creeps come from all angles and and escape mode where you navigate a maze of creeps and obstacles to see how far you go.  

	There are a few cosmetic bugs, but nothing major and I'm sure they will get patched at some point.

	If steam reviews had a “meh” category this game would fall into it.  It's too grindy for a paid game and doesn't really offer enough value for it's price.  Pick it up in a bundle or on sale and wile away a few hours or don't!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977719891', 'num_games_owned': 1315, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1514728143}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025122974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1397134342}
review:
Tydeligvis en port af et mobilspil. Og jeg er sikker på at det har fungeret super godt på den mobile platform, men som PC spil halter det noget efter. 

Lad os starte med selve spillet: Du styrer din Bard, som ikke selv er nogen aggresiv figur, men som summoner hjælpere der slås for ham. Du har plads til 3 forskellige typer units, så du selv kan sætte dit hold sammen. I løbet af spillet låser du op for flere helte, så der er rimelig mulighed for at lave nogle interessante sammensætninger. Du tjener penge i løbet af spillet som du bruger til at låse op for bedre stats og multiplyers. Rimelig simple og basale RPG elementer.

Du bruger WASD til at løbe rundt på banen, som et slags banalt Tower Defense og nedlægger fjender, ind til du, eller det tårn du forsøger at beskytte løber tør for liv. I takt med at du bliver bedre, og får låst op for bedre figurer og skills, bliver løbene længere og længere. 

Teknisk set er spillet egentlig stadig ret pænt, selvom det kommer fra en lille skærm og nu op på en stor. Og styringen fungerer rimelig godt med WASD, samt JKL og UIO til at summone helte og aktivere skills. Men musikken er forfærdelig monotom og jeg anbefaler at du sætter noget andet musik på istedet. Jeg oplevede at når jeg slog musikken fra, fjernede den også lyden fra heltene, hvilket er en skam (men det kan godt være jeg har begået en fejl her).

Som du kan se har jeg brugt over 6 timer på spillet, og det er vel også fint nok udbytte af et billigt spil, men hovedparten af tiden i spillet har egentlig kedet mig, men jeg ville bare gennemføre ihvertfald hoveddelen af spillet. Det er en lang grind af penge, for at få de nødvendige upgrades for at kunne klare dig igennem den samme bane om og om igen.

Der er et par ekstra modes man kan spille, men de virker ret ligegyldige, udover at du kan bruge dem til at unlocke 2 ekstra helte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041124482', 'num_games_owned': 1945, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1554672177}
review:
Bardbarian ist ein iPAD Spiel, dass auf den PC portiert wurde. 
Man bewegt eine Figur mit dem Steuerkreuz des Gamepads über 
den Bildschirm und sammelt Punkte, indem man seine Mitstreiter die Gegner angreifen lässt. 
Das Spiel vermittelt das Gefühl eines kostenlosen Flashspieles für den Browser. 
Die Übersetzung ist größtenteils miserabel, dank der vielen Übersetzungslücken.
Die Steuerung ist im Spiel selbst okay. Jedoch kann man dies von der Menüführung nicht behaupten.
Was den Spielspass angeht, muss ich persönlich sagen, dass ich bessere Flashspiele gespielt hab und nicht nach 2 Minuten gelangweilt war. 
Das Einzige, was mir einigermaßen gefallen hat, war die Musik.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018302427', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1397140564}
review:
I do like this game, but think its is best suited to mobile/touch screen devices. I can't recomend it for a PC (and definatly not a Mac PC in this case), the main game has noticable lag (at the moment). Even if the lag is fixed, I can only say that this game is best suited to a mobile/touch screen device.

The second reason I can't recomend it  is because of the repetative grind. Constantly playing through to a death hoping that you have enough gold to make an upgrade to yourself, the town or your units. The games description does state "The usual grind for XP has grown dull, and he has decided to pursue his dreams of making music instead of shedding blood." Note that this does not mean that there is no grind.

While there are two other modes to continue the grind for gold through, they are briefly fun but challenging. The current price is also steep comparing it to the Android version. If the price is similar to the Android one, then it worth checking out at that point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055656538', 'num_games_owned': 5025, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1397235200}
review: Очень бодрый, приятный и яркий Tower Defiance. Отлиное музыкальное сопровождение. Прекрасная анимация и мультяшная графика. Харизматичный главный герой-бард играющий на гитаре. Необычный для жанра геймплей. отлично проработанные юниты, здания и прокачка всего и вся. Сбалансированные противники. Два дополнительных режима игры: Escape (пробежать как можно дальше) и Survival (выживание в замкнутом пространстве с бесконечным спавном). Неожиданно, но игра просто отличная.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018136953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1397078209}
review: The art is endearing, the humor is both crude and clever, there's a load of upgrades and units to go through, and the difficulty came as a welcome surprise, despite how it may initially seem like a weaksauce mobile title. The animation quality and sound-punchiness could be improved, but overall it's been great fun for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991706883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1397088646}
review:
Surprisingly fun little game. It's a nice mixture of tower defense, ARPG, strategy and bullet hell. Thankfully, they removed any kind of IAP from the iOS version and instead, everything has to be bought using ingame currency. It's a little grindy at first, but soon enough you'll find yourself winning obscene amounts of gold and buying any upgrade straight away.
It's really addicting, and for the asking price, it's well worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198034118715', 'num_games_owned': 4134, 'num_reviews': 508, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1397391074}
review:
斧を逆手にエアギターをかき鳴らす戦わない蛮族バードバリアン
彼にできるのは手下を召喚して逃げまわってバフかけるくらい
Wave制で襲い来る敵は全て手下が相手するっていう他力本願ゲー

追随する手下にもライフがあってそっちにも当たらないよう避けつつ
敵を射程内に捉え続けるアクション要素もあるっちゃあるんだけど
基本的には小銭稼いでやられて強化を繰り返すステータス育て系

火力や速力、補助効果のみならず金次第で陣形をより密集させて
避けやすくなんかもできるので序盤はアクション頑張ったところで
どうにもならないんじゃないかっていう値段相応にカジュアルな奴

なぜかタコ父さんが居るけど回避しながら撃つのが基本のゲームで
トゲ鉄球でブン殴りに行くから父さんすごい気軽に死にまくるよ！

author: {'steamid': '76561197968560421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1397204246}
review:
Multiple times i have had to shut down and restart the game completely because the "Stun" move simply stops working. It will be fully charged and ready to go and it just won't work. Simple as that. Lost many long sessions because of this bug.

And the game does a poor job at explaining its own gameplay mechanics (see below)

-Game tells you that you will recieve an additional unit to defend the tower if you upgrade the barracks to the max. But they fail to inform you if that unit is effected by levels, buffers, powerups and they also fail to tell you what type of unit and if that unit can score critical hits or not. Things like this are important to know in strategy games.

-Game allows you to upgrade your player speed and health but fails to inform you if those upgrades carry over to the other gametypes like survival and escape.

-Game lists a "Healer" but feels no need to tell you that the healer sacrifices her OWN health to give you more.

-Towards the end of the game enemies leave a random skull and crossbones stake in the ground and i have no idea what they are. The game does not tell you.

-One perk says "Keep shops open longer, increase drop rate by 50%" which costs 2000 gold, while another perks with a golden axe says "Double your gold drop rate and look good while doing it". Well i purchased the 2000 gold perk and enemies who dropped 13gold before still drop 13 gold now. So obviously that perk is only referring to musical tune drops which would have been nice to know before i spent 2000 gold.

-Game allows you to upgrade your units but fails to explain why characters still "Level up" after killing enemies. Why are my maxxed out units still leveling up? 

-Game tells you units can score critical hits at higher levels but fail to inform you what chance the unit has to score a critical chance or how much more damage a critical hit does.

-Game shows a speed boost buffer but doesn't feel the need to inform you that the speed buffer also increases your units rate of fire as well as movement speed. These things would have been nice to know beforehand.

-Game tells you that the bards rate of musical notes increase while idle, but do not inform you how much more. Same goes for units like the mechanic which build turrets after standing idle for a period of time, they don't tell you how long it takes standing still before he builds a turret and they do not tell you how much damage the turret does or if the turret can score critical hits or not.

-Game does not have a counter to tell you how many active units you have out on the battlefield at once, In the early stage of the game it is easy to count but good luck when you are able to have 9 at once and you have maxxed out "Body spray". Yeah good luck counting 9 individual units all twirling/spinning/sprinting around with thousands of rocks/missiles coming at you. 

It just seems silly to fail to explain simple gameplay mechanics in a game where strategy is key. A small strategical difference can mean the difference between victory or defeat. And the fact that this company does not even feel the need to explain to you what is happening on the battlefield in complete detail is extremely ignorant.

And the overall gameplay setup of the game is just poor. Instead of perks being a bonus to give you an edge over your opponent, its mandatory pre-requisite required to proceed through the campaign. The game is purposely setup to force the player to grind for experience/gold. For example, in order to get past stage2, you need about two hours worth of gold farming to upgrade your characters. Even if you do everything properly in terms of strategy, you simply will not do enough DPS to stop the kamikaze bomber before he reaches your base.

And ironically, for a game that is called "Bardbarian" and is centered around guitar shredding and musical notes. It only has one mediocre background tune for all three game types.

And p.s.The vote up/down option is to determine if the review was helpful or not. Its not a damn like or dislike button

author: {'steamid': '76561198090505414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1415123939}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986970278', 'num_games_owned': 4554, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1425613824}
review:
I have always enjoyed a good tower defense game but to be honest the genre has felt very stale as of late. Most tower defense games are mixtures of previous tower defense games we have all played before. 
In this game however you are moving around the "towers" (that are actually people) in a group while dodging projectiles. It makes for good fun and most importantly it's priced right. I support devs that price their games accordingly. Bardbarian trys something new and for that I give this game a reccomendation.
http://youtu.be/JFRQjoFO7Hc

author: {'steamid': '76561198026318303', 'num_games_owned': 1844, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1396486665}
review:
I played Bardbarian for about 2 hours, and I find it to be an entertaining, tower defense type of casual game.  I've never played it on android phone before, so this review is strictly from the perspective of a PC game.   I tried playing both via keyboard and a xbox 360 controller, and I recommend playing this with the controller.

At a glance, the main game is deceptively simple.  Your tower is on the left side of the map, and creatures approach from the right side of the map.  The hordes of monsters will continuously come at you (first) and the tower (second).  Your Brad the Bardbarian can't do any attacks on his own.  He needs to drum up some tunes on his axe-lute to call up the cavalry--troops who follow your character and fire at the mobs.  You will die sooner or later, but your goal is to last long enough to accumulate gold to buy upgrades for your troops, your hero character, and your town.  These upgrades DO carry over.  The challenge continually increases as monsters appear in greater numbers, and more powerful to boot.  And it becomes apparent that you need upgrades in order to advance further in the story mode. 

The game also comes with a survival mode, and a distance mode.  The survival mode consists of a timer to see how long you last while trying to get troops and dodging enemy fire.  Distance mode involves your character moving from left to right while dodging environmental obstacles and enemy fire.  Both allow you to accumlate gold and possibly unlock new troop units.

I purchased this game for $5.24 on sale at Steam, and to me it's money well spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970803173', 'num_games_owned': 2865, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1658695431}
review:
A fun little game.
At present there are lots of bugs with the game crashing out every now and then, and on load the resolution is set to a wierd size that goes off-screen.
It's worth the couple of quid that they are asking for it, but it'll be a LOT better once the bugs are sorted out!

All in all, a decent iOS port

Additional:
Ok, pretty much all the big bugs (That I've seen) have been squished by now, less than a week after release. They have been very good about fixing issues, getting it all playable quickly.
The game itself just gets better with more play, as you increase the number of unit types that your BardBarian can have assisting him.
A very fun game, 15 different units to play with in whatever combinations you choose. A couple of other game modes other than defend the Village Crystal, Escape and Survival. Both a good challenge, as is the Defend game type.
A great little game and huge value for money at such a bargain price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086404895', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1428485509}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085625081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1396567026}
review:
This game is somewhat buggy right now, sometimes the cursor disappears and I had a few instances of the game not being able to close, making me force close steam.

That being said, this game is a solid fun game that is Plants vs Zombies/Raiden Fighters + RPG elements
Since I enjoy both of those games, I definitely enjoy Bardbarian.
The controls are simple and straightforward, with nice variation between units.  If you prefer to play an attacking, speed, or defensive playstyle, you can change the song to adapt to your needs.
The game is tough enough to be challenging and the enemies are varied enough to be interesting/not super repetitive.

Lots of variation/unlockables and gotta love the MeatBoy crossover.  If they can clean up the bugs I would wholeheartedly recommend, as of now its a yes with precaution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031814442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1397880884}

Shredding and lootin' all day long. Buy it for your friends and buy it for your mom. She'll love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972283960', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1396440760}
review:
While this game looked really cool, I'm glad I bought it while it was on sale.
Simply put it is a mobile game ported to steam but nothing feels like it has been added.
It is a pure time waster as you must grind to get coins to upgrade units to get further, but with a limit for 3 followers (for the time being I haven't seen any hints of being able to unlock more) and units who just gain more HP it really feels like a pure grind with no real end point.
Also I found it frustrating to have to work out what the other two powers ups do as the tutorial only covers the first one (which in my mind is the only one worth using now I have played a bit more) 
This really doesn't feel like a game I will keep playing past another the 2-3 hour mark and even then I only played for so long just to see if it went anywhere else.
TL:DR. Pure mobile game port and not worth the money in its current state.
PS: I hope you prove me wrong in future updates BardBarian, as I like the concept but the game-play is boring and repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004739104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1396449183}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SWMKYNaV6b8

Video Review Above!


What a fun addicting game this is.  Treefortress really hit this one out of the park.  I picked this game up thinking it might be interesting and 5 hours later it was 2 am and I frantically went back and forth
from the different game modes trying to earn more gold and discover the hidden minions.

Bardbarian is like a RTS/TD game where you are brad and by using your awesome axe-lute you can summon different minions to destroy waves of enemies attacking your village.  You are also able to buff your
minions with power rifts using notes that you passively generate.  There are three modes story, escape and survival.  All of which you earn gold to level up all of your minions abilities and even some
of the village, like the town drunk( he vomits everywhere to slow the enemies down :)).  As you progress through the story mode you are able to unlock more minions which gives you vast flexibility on your playstyle
and strategy as that you can only have 3 minions to choose from any given attempt.

the game has two difficulty settings normal and insane.  Insane is... well pretty much insane.  The story mode is split into three parts morning, noon and night I still haven't been able to get through noon 
on normal so there is a lot of game here for the $.  Speaking of which at 6.99 this game is an absolute steal.  If you are still reading this, what's wrong with you, go buy the game you won't regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129874746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1396780744}
review:
フルコントローラーサポートってゲームパッドは別物なんですね
キャラの移動は反転してるし、ボタンの再配置は出来ないからボタン配置無茶苦茶だし
箱丸コントローラーは在庫無いから試してないよ！黙ってキーボードでやるのが吉

肝心のゲーム内容は、まあまあ…かな？
右から押し寄せてくる敵を自分の後ろについて来るユニットやユニットを強化するスキルを駆使して
一番左にあるクリスタルを壊されないよう撃退していく、タワーディフェンス的な内容です
が、ユニットが主人公のけっつを金魚のふん見たいに常について歩き
マップもそれなりに広いので多少アクションよりかも知れないです

ユニットの強化やスキルの追加などすべて敵を倒してお金で買っていくので
何度も同じ事の繰り返しにナリがち、私はもう飽きてきましたw（開始３０分程度）

後、多少下品な表現が多いのでそれも今一やる気の乗らない原因に…
そういうの気にならない人にはお勧め
ストーリーも大したな下げなので英語も読めなくてもおkです

review:
A great game for anyone who likes rpg and has a tolerence for repetitive gameplay. This game is free on the andriod so you really don't have to spend anymoney if you don't want to. Defend your town with a set of units and upgrade units,hero,and town once you die rinse and repeat.I hope they add more things that can be used to defend the town with like barricades or something cause as of right now there isn't really much strategy more running around and evading projectiles,and waiting for your unit's to fire.

Overall if you enjoy what you see in the screenshots  and video you will like this game. If you don't you can always just play the android version.

review:

It also has quite some bugs and an uncompleted localization with no option to change the language.
Overall it feels more like a beta then a polished product.

The game itself is enjoyable for a short period of time, but if you are bored fast, don't like guitar music, are easily annoyed by bugs or genereally are low on money, don't get it.

review: It is a really fun game and not hard at all although it does get graduelly harder its not impossibly hard so although it does bring a challange and you will be able to get though it so loong as you pay attention to were the enemy projectiles are comming from but i would recommend the game for the price it is

author: {'steamid': '76561197975401914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1396570971}
review:
Ótimo joguinho no estilo Tower Defense com elementos de RPG. Lindo visual, trilha sonora de rock muito maneira e uma jogabilidade viciante. Não sei se sou só eu, mas me lembra bastante de Plants vs. Zombies. Preço justo pelo conteúdo. Pedida certa para fãs do gênero ou para os interessados em conhecê-lo.

Great little Tower Defense style game with RPG elements. Beautiful visuals, awesome rock soundtrack, addictive gameplay. I don't know if it's just me, but it reminds me a lot of Plants vs. Zombies. Fair price for the content. Must buy for TD fans or if you wanna try it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974422658', 'num_games_owned': 2219, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1574, 'last_played': 1669500815}
review: This game is pretty awesome!!! But then again i am a Tower Defense Game Maniac. So if you ar also into TD Games; Grab it when it' still hot. ^^ 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052482102', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1407174090}
review: This is a cheerful and colourful game which you will definately love. Really nice art, makes you wanna play more and more. It gives you this feeling of being refreshed. Wonderful game! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994702618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1396422229}
review: This is what Plants Vs. Zombies 2 should've been like. And if EA hadn't got it's greasy mitts on Popcap, it would've been a joy. This however is a really nice evolution of the formula and is a real treat. It needs a little more depth, and some new environments would be nice, but the mechanics are solid and there is some good variety and it's suprisingly challenging. The whole game is really simple, but that's what makes it great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058958967', 'num_games_owned': 546, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1396395567}
review: First off, very fun game.  At first I thought this would be an easy game but obviously as levels progress hordes of mobes get tougher but as you kill you collect gold which you may use to upgrade your hero, your minions and few other things.  You unlock new units the further you survive.  This is a great Tower defense/RTS game, dont think i played another like it but soon as I saw trailer I bought it.This is a well done game thats pretty challenging.  I'll be playing this for a while.
